venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath.

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program.


When: Fridays at 1pm. Please
arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.
results.name: Breathe Meditate and Rejuvenate !

results.description:
Join us for three days of life changing adventure at magical Pumpkin Hollow Retreat Center. What a delight to start a morning with sunrise mediation and gentle yoga practice followed by delicious healthy breakfast. Make sure you bring your swimwear for a natural water pool and get ready for the most amazing dancing experience (we have surprises for you). You will absolutely love our group coaching workshop and a company of awesome people!

Pumpkin Hollow Retreat Center is situated on a 130 acres of land. The property is surrounded by beautiful green forest, waterfall, natural spring. We will be able to harvest our own food from the retreat centers organic garden and learn how to prepare delicious healing meals.

Space is limited. Please, Register Here : https://joywithin.eventbrite.com

Come with an open heart and mind. We are looking forward to create this experience with you!


To get to know magical Pumkin Hollow Retreat Center

visit: www.pumpkinhollow.org


What others say about our work:

"This is a program which treats the body and mind as a whole--and it has been more empowering than any therapist or book I have ever encountered". Simon P.

"I totally enjoyed spending time with you. You gave me the tools i was looking for at this point of my life, you were a great help with your knowledge, ability to share and listen". Sophie D.

"I learned more than I thought I would, and I finally understood how important the mind-body connection is in this journey". Ann A.

"amazing" Terry B.

"Had an amazing time! made all the difference.i have learned that It’s not just about eating better, rather about being in tune with your body, knowing your body and keeping it in balance". Ava D.

"Really great time! Met a new friend" - Elisa A.

"What a great experience! Just what I needed. I realized I have been hibernating with worry. Thanks for all the great suggestions" Michelle W.
results.name: JOY WITHIN WEEKEND RETREAT - Yoga,dance,meditation, nature & friends.

group.name: Destination Backcountry: Wilderness Adventures for NYCers

results.description:
Hi all,

Our last get together was such fun that, due to popular demand, we'll have an August meetup for the first time! Let's enjoy a long leisurely summer lunch and revel in each others company.

Looking forward to seeing you,

Renate

PS: When you RSVP "Yes" but can't make it after all, PLEASE change your status immediately! I need to let restaurants know exactly how many people to expect AND those who come need to order at a reasonable time. Waiting for people who never show up puts me in a difficult position. Thank you for your consideration.

PPS: To offset the recently increased fee meetup.com charges for its services, I will collect $3 from each participant after the meal. Thank you!
results.name: August Park Slope Lunch Club Meetup

Make sure you bring your swimwear for a natural water pool and get ready for the most amazing dancing experience (we have surprises for you). You will absolutely love our group coaching workshop and a company of awesome people!


Pumpkin Hollow Retreat Center is located on a 130 acres of land. The property is surrounded by beautiful green forest, waterfall, natural spring. We will be able to harvest our own food from the retreat centers organic garden and learn how to prepare delicious healing meals.

Space is limited. Please, Register Here : https://joywithin.eventbrite.com

Come with an open heart and mind. We are looking forward to create this experience with you!

----------------------------------
To get to know magical Pumkin Hollow Retreat Center

visit: www.pumpkinhollow.org

--------------------------------
What others say about our work:

"This is a program which treats the body and mind as a whole--and it has been more empowering than any therapist or book I have ever encountered". Simon P.

"I totally enjoyed spending time with you. You gave me the tools i was looking for at this point of my life, you were a great help with your knowledge, ability to share and listen". Sophie D.

"I learned more than I thought I would, and I finally understood how important the mind-body connection is in this journey". Ann A.

"amazing" Terry B.

"Had an amazing time! made all the difference.i have learned that It’s not just about eating better, rather about being in tune with your body, knowing your body and keeping it in balance". Ava D.

"Really great time! Met a new friend" - Elisa A.

"What a great experience! Just what I needed. I realized I have been hibernating with worry. Thanks for all the great suggestions" Michelle W.

group.name: Long Island Alternative Health Meetup Group

results.description:
https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/ettZn0lvSuq7UgsP4pea

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/GakuBY

Discover how the chaos of the Lower East Side has shaped—and continues to shape—the destiny of the art world. There’s an incredible amount of street art in New York City whether Banksy (English) or eL Seed (Arabic) have “residencies” here or not. See and learn who and what inspired today’s fascinating mix of paste-ups, stencils, memorials, tags and throws. Get the context behind Banksy’s 2013 street art blitz right here in the streets where hip hop and graffiti began. Besides the latest street art, we’ll explore earlier art in and about the streets, and learn how museums like the New Museum and Warhol Museum have taken note.

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/GakuBY

results.description:
Hi Everyone- Hope all is well! Being that it is summer time and some of our kids are all getting bigger I thought it would be nice to have meetup outside at the park. I also am going to change the meetup date as well to Fridays in the summer so I can attend! 

We won't be meeting for a few weeks, but will resume meetup at St Catherine's Park on Friday, July 10th at 2pm. 

I hope to see you all there!

I miss you guys!

Lesley

results.description:
Join us and Foster Dogs NYC at Sean Casey Animal Rescue's (SCAR) Windsor Terrace shelter on Friday, August 28th from 3:00pm to 5:00pm! Spend the afternoon outside exploring the area with wonderful adoptable dogs. Check out or photos of previous walks!

August is also SCAR's month for our Steps Fur Pets campaign. You can participate and support SCAR as you walk with the free ResQwalk app! Each week, ResQwalk divides a donation pool (about $850) between animal rescues around the country. The more miles logged, the more money each rescue receives. Volunteers must be 18+ and must fill out a dog walking volunteer form. Each walk is about 15-45 minutes, depending on how long you (or the dog!) want to stay out. You can walk as many dogs as you like. You can print the dog walking volunteer form in advance to save some time at the shelter, but it's not required: http://nyanimalrescue.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/SCAR-Dog-Walker-Package-MAIN1.pdf.

If you're bringing a friend along, just know that you will only be able to walk one dog at a time if you walk together. Dogs are not allowed to walk together. We can't wait to see you there!

results.description:
Late summer in the ADKs is great - not too hot and not too buggy. 

I'll be doing some slides (advanced hikes) and there are plenty of other great hikes for all abilities too. 


-Andre

---------------------------------

Carpooling: Please post in the comment section if you're driving and from where. Riders should chip in for gas and tolls.

----------------------------------

Cost:  Campsites are $17/person. Please send payment via PayPal to [masked]

Sorry, I can't offer refunds.  

----------------------------------

Hikes are member organized:

Post any suggestions in the comments below. Be sure to include a start time Saturday morning since people will be arriving late Friday night. 

All participants must be able navigate and hike independently. Discuss the route, expected pace, and backup meeting places with any people you hike with before the start of a hike. 

Remember that you are responsible for your own safety.  

--------------------------------------

The Rough Plan: 


Friday: Leave as early in the afternoon as you can. It is 5 hours to the campground. 

Saturday: We'll raise early for our various hikes. 

Sunday: Generally a short hike before hitting the road.


Hikes: The high peaks have dozens of great hikes with 360-degree views. Popular moderate hikes (5-10 miles) within 30mins of the campground include Noonmark, Hurricane, the Brothers, and Giant mountains. There are a lot of excellent strenuous hikes as well. 

Camping: We'll be car-camping at the Sharp Bridge campground with showers, toilets, and picnic tables. 

Food: BYO Food. There are restaurants near the trail heads if you want to stop for dinner, but you should bring your own breakfasts and lunches. 


Required Camping Gear: 


-Tent, sleeping pad and sleeping bag suitable for the 40s at night. (Can be rented at REI or EMS in the city)
-Stove, pots and pan  (check about sharing)
-Personal plate/spoon/cup, etc; toiletries; flip-flops for the shower

Required Hiking Gear: 
-Standard day hiking gear
-Waterproof Boots (trail shoes are not recommended) 
-Rain gear (just in case)
-Map of the hike peaks region


Weather: Average hi/low: 70s/40s. Weather above the treeline is always worse, so bring a good shell and an extra layer.
results.name: Adirondacks! Car camping & day hikes

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
I am excited to share that I am participating in a GrassRoots movement with people here in our community and around the world. I help facilitate strictly educational classes which provide exposure to education we otherwise wouldn’t have an option for or, at least, easy access to. Topics include:

1. Altered Food and How the foundation of our food have been modified and the consequences

2. Vitamins & Minerals What’s natural about being synthetic? As it applies to supplementation The Science of Glycobiology. What is glycosylation and how does it affect the proper function of your immune system? In today's modern world, one out of twenty five people suffer from autoimmune disorder. Stress, pollutions in the environment, and the lack of nutrition found in our foods are not all but a few causes which contribute to an immune disorder. Glycobiology is the study of the structure, function and biology of carbohydrates, also called glycans, which are widely distributed in nature. It is a small but rapidly growing field in biology, GLYCOBIOLOGY AS IMMUNE While sugar-nutrients do not treat specific diseases, they do allow for the cells to send proper messages within the body. When our cells communicate clearly, it is amazing what the immune system is capable of doing. Our bodies know how to make corrections and restore proper function, given the raw materials they need. These critical sugars are like the vowels in our alphabet. When the vowels are in place we understand our conversation. Glycans are complex carbohydrate structures that cover the surfaces of all mammalian cells, as they are added to proteins- and lipid backbones by the so-called glycosylation machinery enzymes, present in every cell. Glycans are the outer part of glycoproteins and form recognition elements for glycan sensor molecules that, upon recognition, mediate cellular communication. Glycan recognition plays a crucial role in cellular communication between immune cells. Dendritic cells that stimulat or inhibiting immune responses express many glycan sensor molecules. These glycan sensor molecules (called lectins) recognize specific glycans and can thereby instruct tailor made immune responses. Recognition of glycans on pathogens by dendritic cells can initiate immunological defense. There are approximately two hundred simple sugars found in nature but only the eight listed below are found in various combinations surrounding every single cell in the body, and are dominant ingredients in mothers’ breast milk.

Many of these sugars are stripped out of our modern, highly processed foods. They are also gravely missing from whole foods due to green harvesting and soil depletion. Our experience has been that the addition of these types of sugar-nutrients can have extremely positive effects on immune function and overall well-being. We are a society that is lead to believe that our bodies aren't capable of maintaining health and wellness on it's own, but when the immune system is able to communicate properly the body listens which makes the wellness journey not only exciting but transformational. Workshop schedule : 1. Meet and Greet

2. Altered Food How the foundation of our food has been altered and its consequences

3. Vitamins & Minerals What’s natural about being synthetic? As it applies to supplementation.

4.The Science of Glycobiology What is glycosylation and how does it affect the proper function of your immune system? 5. Wellness Support/ Q & A For Further inquiries about this workshop please do not hesitate to send Laura Schwalm an email at [masked]

Love and light, Laura Schwalm
results.name: Glycobiology and Building Immune Health

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

group.name: ...And That's Why You're Single Speed Dating Parties

results.description:
Hi everyone,

We are back after a short break in July. Our next monthly event will be at the Bourbon St. Bar. It's a great place with lots of atmosphere and reasonably priced food and drinks.

We had a great night last time - beautiful weather and great atmosphere. Once again, we have a large area reserved for us at the upstairs bar on the second floor on the indoor patio. (By the way, the patio has a retractable roof, so we will be there rain or shine.)

I hope to see many of you there and I look forward to meeting all you new members.

See you soon,

Anthony
results.how_to_find_us: We will be upstairs on the patio

results.description:
There's been a lot of Summer parties but we've saved the best for last! Don't miss our annual End Of Summer Singles Bash!   

Join 300+ singles at this upscale multi-Meetup taking place at one of the hottest venues in NYC! Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge & rooftop, the luxurious 230 Fifth is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline.  

What to expect:

• 2 for 1 Drinks (6-7pm)

• Free Light Appetizers

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "BASH" at checkout - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door   

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, shorts, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. This event is mostly for 20s-40s. It is not ethnic specific.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending. Get tickets here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for Meetup members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided at the door

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
#nycgamenight

**** The August 28th Friday Game Night will again be sponsored by my website, www.blacklatinomedianetwork.com, so admission again will be FREE!!! If you love to play Spades, Bid Whist or any of the old school classic games, while enjoying laughs, great drinks and food in a very cool lounge, be sure to come through and check out Game Night for free on Friday July 10th!!!****


You are invited to join us after work on Friday August 28th for our next Game Night  at 49 Grove, downtown in NYC!!!

http://youtu.be/nRGX2TK9ay4

Our event Host Pedro (AKA "Peter") will be your Host for the evening!


49 Grove is a sexy lounge and is a spacious venue, so there is plenty of room to walk around the very attractive space, while mingling with not only other Group members within our VIP section, but with other Latino and Black professionals throughout the rest of the club.

There are two separate rooms with plenty of couches and separate nooks to lounge in!

Start Time: 6pm

End Time: 10pm

At this Meetup, we will have several tables available for those that wish to play cards or board games. The list of games available include:

Spades

Taboo

Backgammon

Dominoes

Chess

Checkers

Uno

Connect 4

Monopoly

Trouble

Life

Scattegories

and MANY MANY MORE!!!

Please note the details below:

You have to tell the doorman that you are on the Black/Latino Afterwork Drinks Meetup Guestlist.

50% off all Specialty Martinis until 8pm!!!.

Food will be available for order from the kitchen.

We will have music playing as well for those that may want to get some dancing in there in between playing games! :)

We look forward to seeing you there!!!
results.name: Game Night Fridays & 1/2 off Martinis  @ 49 Grove!!! (FREE ADMISSION)

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Francisco/Silvia)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Ahhh, MoMA, the feelings about it run the gamut from hate to love and all the various shades between. The thing upon which everyone can agree, though, is that MoMA and it's many exhibits are great for starting conversation. Whether you're a modern art enthusiast, an open-minded observer, or can't stand the stuff- there's always something that will spark at least a comment, and then a discussion to follow up. Whether the discussion is to agree, argue, or simply to clarify, it usually ends up being pretty engaging. And so there you have my reason for wanting to bring all of you there. If you're looking for the opportunity to expound on the genius of some abstraction of the state of modern man, or possibly just the chance to crack some jokes on some of the wierder pieces, we provide the company for you to do it in.

So if you're interested in meeting a bunch of good people, checking out one of the best museums in the City, and also seeing some art you may or may not find to be odd, you're more than welcome to join us for the evening.

Some extra details:

Did you know that every Friday night, it's free to get into MoMA? If you didn't, now you do! And that's the reason we're headed there on a Friday evening- easy on the eyes AND the wallet. How can you beat that?

Before anyone asks, I will be getting something to eat in the area afterwards. If other people would like to join me, that'd be great- in fact the part of a meetup I generally enjoy most is sharing a meal with people afterwards. Keep in mind, though, that there may be more people than will fit in whatever place I choose. If so, I encourage you to break off into groups with the people whose company you most enjoyed, and enjoy whatever restaurant you choose for yourself. But that's for then, and we'll worry about it when we come to it.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll Meet on the Northwest corner of West 53rd St. and Fifth Ave. (The corner of St. Thomas Church).
results.name: Let's Go to MoMA!

EVENT TYPE: Night Life

ADMISSION COST: Free

PLEASE NOTE:

• Everyone needs to have ID and obey their dress code. The below link with give you more information. http://www.thepresslounge.com/door-dress-policies/

• Rain or shine this place has an indoor and outdoor lounge.

• There is always a chance that this event may get cancel as some rich dude can buyout the whole roof top and kick everyone out.

DESCRIPTION:

The Press Lounge offers some of Manhattan’s most beautiful and dramatic panoramic views. Refined elegance comes in subtle luxuries: a glass walled interior space, seasonal cocktails, an extensive wine list, seasonally inspired small plates and informed and welcoming service. Situated atop of the Ink48 Hotel, the Press Lounge is the sister venue to PRINT. Restaurant, owned and operated by Adam Block. Opened in 2010, it quickly became recognized as one of Manhattan’s finest rooftop lounges; Frank Bruni, of the New York Times, wrote that the Press Lounge was “without question, one of the city’s most attractive rooftop bars”. In the same year, New York Magazine recognized it as New York’s “Top New Rooftop Bar,” ABC News.com rated it as one of the top 22 rooftops in the world, and Urban Daddy named the Press Lounge as the Perfect ’10 .

This is a faith-based movie. Here is a short synopsis:

"Tony and Elizabeth Jordan have it all—great jobs, a beautiful daughter, and their dream house. But appearances can be deceiving. Tony and Elizabeth Jordan’s world is actually crumbling under the strain of a failing marriage." "A Christian family under worldly pressures is shown by a wise older woman (Karen Abercrombie) how to make a "war room" as a prayerful place in the home to turn the family's path around."

There is a 7:20 pm showing at AMC 25 in Times Square. Here is a link to the site. Please get your tickets ahead of time. There is a Five Guys right across the street from the theater. We can meet there at 6pm for anyone that wants to eat before the movie. We can also have some chill time after the movie for the night owls..

results.description:
Encanta is a play about a pirate with a checkered past who embarks on her most dangerous adventure yet...winning the heart of a terrifying sorceress with a bad attitude. In addition, the play was written by a gay female playwright which is super exciting to hear.

“What's interesting about this play, aside from magic and pirates, is that the romantic leads are both women (the men get to be sidekicks and comic relief) who fall in love with each other.”-Shawn, the playwright!

The cost will be $20 per person.

I don’t know about you but I’m incredibly excited that this exists and can’t wait to see it play out on stage! Please RSVP so we know how many people are going. HOWEVER, seating is general admission, so you MUST reserve your own tickets by emailing [masked] and indicate 1) Name of Show (Encanta), 2) Date of Show (Aug 28, 2015), and 3) Number of tickets. Thanks!

here is more information about the play: http://encantatheplay.weebly.com/


Directions:

Manhattan Rep is located at 303 W. 42nd Street at 8th Avenue, on the 6th Floor.

(Directly across the street from Port Authority Bus Terminal in TIMES SCARE building.)

Subway:

 A, C, E to 42nd Street and 8th Ave. (Port Authority Bus Terminal)

1, 2, 3, R, N, Q, Times Square Shuttle, to Times Square.

Exit to 42nd St. Walk one block West to 303 W. 42nd St.

Bus:

M104, get off at 42nd and 8th Ave.  Walk across 8th Ave to 303 W. 42nd St.

M42, 

Stop is right in front of the theatre

Metro North:

Get off at Grand Central Station

Transfer to Times Square shuttle to 42nd St. and Times Square

Exit to 42nd St. Walk one block West to 303 W. 42nd St.

Driving:

From Long Island Expressway

Head southwest on I-495W toward the midtown tunnel

After exiting the tunnel, turn right at E.34th Street

Turn right at 8th Ave

Turn left at W.42nd Street

Manhattan Repertory is on the Right at 8th Ave in TIMES SCARE building.


From Westchester:

Take Saw Mill River Parkway South

until it merges into the Henry Hudson Parkway

Keep going.

Turn left at W. 42nd Street

Manhattan Repertory is on the left at 8th Ave in TIMES SCARE building.

From Staten Island:

From Verrazano Bridge

Merge onto I-278E

Continue on I-478N for Battery Tunnel to Manhattan

Turn right at New York 9A N/ West Street

Turn right at W. 42nd Street

Manhattan Repertory is on the left at 8th Ave in TIMES SCARE building.

From New Jersey:

From 1-95E take Lincoln Tunnel (Exit 16E)

After leaving Tunnel, turn left

Go to 42nd Street

Turn right on 42nd Street

Manhattan Rep is on the left at 8th Ave in TIMES SCARE building.

results.description:
End the week and join Gay Williamsburg for an evening BBQ  with some frisbee thrown in!

We'll BBQ in McCarren park very close to (and in visual sight of) the entrance at Roebling St and Union Avenue.   Go to the corner, and you will see us with a small BBQ and table set up.

Our very own GW member Mauricio (Mo) has kindly offered to purchase the burgers, dogs and toppings on the group's behalf, as well as deli salads, the BBQ coal and possibly some cookie desserts.

We will be collecting $10 from each person at the BBQ to cover the cost of the food.

As to beverages, please bring your own drinks, as we all have our preferences!  If you have "adult" beverages be sure to wrap or bring in a different container.

What's a BBQ without a mini-activity?  In between eating and socializing, we'll have an ultimate frisbee "net" set up, where we can test our ultimate accuracy.  We'll also have some regular frisbees to toss around for those that need a break from eating.

If you have an old picnic blanket or sheet, please bring it. If you can come a little early to help Mo with the set up, please let me know your contact details and availability time.

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Entrance at Roebling St and Union Avenue
results.name: McCarren Park BBQ!

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, shorts, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. This event is mostly for 20s-40s. It is not ethnic specific.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? 

This is a multi-Meetup event.

This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending.

Note, this is not an Indian-only event, but we have a large Indian following, so you can expect to see lots of Indian singles in attendance.

results.description:
REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE: http://realestateblueprint.eventbrite.com

As an agent you only have so much time in the day and finding quality investment opportunities for your investors can prove to be a challenge. You may have your local investors who ask you about investing in markets outside your area of expertise and you are unclear on how to uncover investment opportunities for them.  This can be an opportunity lost or you lose control of your clients by passing them on to a local agent for a small referral fee.

Strongbrook Real Estate is offering a new program for licensed brokers and agents who specialize in working with real estate investors.  In your personal network do you work with investors who want deals with built in equity or deals with positive cash-flow income?  Are you looking for opportunities to bring to your local investors in markets outside of your area of expertise?

By becoming an Approved Agent or Broker you will be able to leverage Strongbrook’s Real Estate's Investment Organization’s size and negotiating power as a group to bring your personal network of investors better deals, in markets all around the country and earn referral and marketing fees equivalent to full cooperating commissions.

Not a real estate agent and want to learn about this lucrative field?

We have THE solution! 

Expands your reach for property inventory into the best markets in the nation, and transforms your idle client database into active real estate investors. 

Leverage the expertise, relationships, and infrastructure of Strongbrook’s entire professional team whose focus is: 

1) Training new and existing real estate investors how to create a custom game plan for retirement by conservatively purchasing cash flowing properties in the best markets.

2) Providing investors “ready-to-buy” properties.

3) Assisting investors in managing and maintaining monthly cash flow and profit. 

Strongbrook does all of this for you! 

Your clients will receive the best service and a carefully crafted step-by-step process for real estate investing success. 

Are you ready to increase your real estate transactions and revenue? 

You Can Do It!

REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE: http://realestateblueprint.eventbrite.com
results.name: The Strongbrook Real Estate Blueprint for Brokers and Agents

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk toward the back of the lobby, we'll be on the raised section on the left.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description:
For our summer 2014 games, we shall be playing with a new format:

• 8 minutes/ 2 goals game. The games will be 2 hours long.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, (6 outfield players and a goalkeeper).

• Lime green colored pinnies (practice jerseys) will be provided for one of the teams to diffrentiate teams.

Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Friday soccer under the sky!

results.description:
NYC PARKS PRESENTS ARTS, CULTURE & FUN
Dance Away the Night series
A Night of Tango!

Always wanted to visit Argentina, the land of the sensual, romantic Tango? Spend a special evening with a Taste of Tango. Enjoy live music, tango stories, dance demonstrations and tango classes!
Strictly Tango NYC Dance School, bring you the "authentic Buenos Aires Tango feeling". Everyone will learn, dance and have fun. It will be a night full of surprises. Don't miss it!

Friday, August 28th, 2015
6:00 – 8:00 p.m.
Hunter’s Point South Park
Center Blvd and Borden Avenue
Queens, NY 11109
For more information call[masked] Why Tango? It’s a great way to meet people! Tango is at its core is a highly social dance. Whether you’re making new friends in class, or dancing with a new partner for the first time, tango is guaranteed to widen your circle of friends. Tango dancers attend milongas, (social dances), held weekly around the city and are a great a way to mingle and show off your moves in a friendly environment.

In partnership with Strictly Tango a premier authentic Argentine Tango school at 500 8th Avenue. The school is dedicated to authentic Argentine Tango with renowned teachers like Sergio Segura; show producer, choreographer, dance researcher and creator of the “Learn Argentine Tango System.” Visit their website to learn more www.learnargentinetango.com

The event is free and open to all. Register at: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=46543
results.name: Free Taste of Tango in the Queens

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

The Third Annual Rahway International Film Festival returns on August 28-30, 2015 at UCPAC's Hamilton Stage for the Performing Arts. This year’s lineup is full of brilliant independent films by filmmakers spanning 12 different countries as well as by local filmmakers right here in NJ. A highlight of this year’s festival is the introduction of feature length films in addition to short films, plus a special Saturday night outdoor screening.


Indoor Film Screenings ... $15
Outdoor Film Screening ... $10
Seminars ... $10
Opening Night Gala Screening + Cocktail Hour ... $28  


Special Limited Time Packages:
Saturday All-Access Pass ... $35
Sunday All-Access Pass ... $35


**10% of all ticket sales will be donated to the charities: 

Integrity House

 

& 

National Alliance on Mental Illness

For more info, check out: http://www.rahwayfilmfest.com/

results.description:
After the very successful first meetup organized, there is no reason not to do it again...and again! This event is now recurring every fourth Friday of every month, so mark your calendars, ladies! Please see "upcoming meetups" section for the exact dates. 

How to join:

Mark yourself as attending, and if you wish, inbox me your personal info (phone and email) so it is easier to coordinate. 

Going forward, we are expelling all the members who RSVP-ed but did not make it to our events without cancelling 24h in advance. We apologize, but we have to ensure high quality  standards for our upcoming meetups by restricting the meetups to 15 people maximum.


Where the event will be held: 

The exact location is only visible to the members of this group and may change every time a new meetup is organized based on recommendations. Please see "location details" to find out where this meetup will be held. 

You can bring a +1 or +2, no need to ask me beforehand. The more, the merrier! 

I am looking forward to meeting all of you!  

Cindy

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
I'm a playwright with a show coming up late this month about a pirate with a checkered past who embarks on her most dangerous adventure yet...winning the heart of a terrifying sorceress with a bad attitude. What's interesting about this play, aside from magic and pirates, is that the romantic leads are both women who fall in love with each other. And all the characters--every single one--is LGBT. If you're looking for something to do later this month, may I suggest coming to see "Encanta"?

WHERE: Manhattan Repertory Theatre (303 W. 42nd Street. Right across from Port Authority.)
HOW MUCH: $20.
TO RESERVE TICKETS: Send an e-mail to [masked]. You pay for the tickets when you arrive.
WEBSITE: http://encantatheplay.weebly.com/
FB EVENTS: https://www.facebook.com/CrossroadsTheatreProject/events
results.name: Come see ENCANTA, a story about magic, true love, and ladies loving ladies

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

Hey everybody,

It's been a long time since we've gotten together at the Met and now that the weather is finally starting to cool off a bit, it's the perfect time during these dog days of August.


Of course if only a couple of people sign up or the weather is bad then I will reschedule.


For those who are new, I will be holding a sizeable Canadian flag that lights up.


For anyone who tires of the great views quickly, the museum is open until 8:45 on Friday so you can check out some art too. And if people would like to get some food after, I'm happy to coordinate that too.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Join us as we watch and discuss part 1: The Invisible Science of the 8 part documentary series: Magical Egypt from a Rosicrucian Perspective.

View Website Here!

View Video Here!

Summary:

There is another side of Egypt that is not so widely known. Egypt is also the land of secrets. Another history, a secret history, tells of Egypt as the inheritor of deep wisdom and magical ability from an even earlier culture. It is the account of the Egyptians themselves. This alternate history is echoed by parallel accounts from the myth and history of other ancient cultures, as well as myriad secret societies and occult sources. The remarkable number of parallels in these stories provides a unique window into this other Egypt.

A new kind of counterculture is emerging around the unexpected discoveries of a small but growing circle of scientists, authors and researchers. The focal point of this counterculture centers on an alternative interpretation of ancient Egypt - not as mankind's earliest attempts at primitive civilization, but as a fully developed, and inexplicably advanced culture, who's scientific and metaphysical achievements we are only beginning to fully appreciate.

All Are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Magical Egypt: The Invisible Science

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No Permit but field is usually available for us at this time.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- JJ)

(Co-Leader- David Toro)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Location:

Chelsea Studios

151 West 26th Street 6th Floor New York, NY 10001

Ask for Chelsea Studios!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you arrive before 6:30pm, please wait downstairs. An organizer will be waiting with a sign and will bring you to the classroom when we are ready. If you arrive after 6:45pm, check in with the guard, and remember to bring a form of ID. Go to the 6th floor and look for us there!

Don't forget to bring a notebook!

Here are some pictures from our latest session!

 

 

Thank you!

results.description:
Sorry this meetup is full!!!


The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... SWIM... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - SWIM + FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim/Drink/Party at Community Beach / Lake. Chill in the warm Shallow Lake water. Bringing POOL Floaties, Pool Lounge, Swim Rings etc. Then WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.name: Sorry, Full... Hike + Swim + Bonfire + Party + Fun Activities in Mtns of PA!!!

results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed:
- In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what you signed up for, I need that to keep track! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun!

results.description:
Come gather with others in the light and experience a group Reiki session!  Each circle includes brief discussion, guided meditation, and hands on healing via chair Reiki.  Open to the public!

Reiki is a technique for channeling energy through the hands to bring healing to the body.  It works on many levels of the mind, body, and spirit.  The purpose of Reiki is to relieve stress and pain, enhance relaxation, release blockages, amplify natural healing, and lend balance to our busy lives.  Reiki supports all medical protocols in a gentle cooperative manner.

All are welcome!  Looking forward to working with you in the energy.  $15 donation.
results.name: Group Reiki Session

group.name: Get Your Energy On in NJ

results.description:
I know a lot of you out there have wanted to try a Reiki treatment but private sessions are cost prohibitive to most so I have been trying to figure out how to bring you a group session. I finally found someone to work with me to bring in enough energy to benefit everyone. I am teaming up with Kris from Integrated Healing Therapies so that we can work together and do several people at once.

For those who don't know what Reiki is here is a good article on it: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiki

Also check out:  16-things-you-didnt-know-about-reiki.html

It is a technique for channeling energy to individuals and to things to bring healing and to set intentions too. Maybe you suffer from headaches, or joint pain, perhaps depression or anxiety or stress from the job? Maybe you need more courage to find a better job, or you've been feeling sad lately. Reiki can virtually work on ANYTHING to improve your mind, body and soul!

So here's the plan, come to my house by 7pm (we will meet in the basement just come around back) and bring $15 cash exact change please, wear something comfortable and if you want bring a light blanket to cover yourself with. We will get you comfortable and do some sharing and then do a guided meditation to relax you and then she and I will go around to each of you for a few minutes of focused energy to each of you to get you truly connected to the light.

I so look forward to sharing this with you!  Love, Cassie

If you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: white house, black trim (GPS may say you are here 2 blocks too soon)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

I am very happy to organize the 5th jazz & wine social with Steinway & Sons for our members at a new Steinway Showroom. One of our past events at Steinway Hall went so successfully that even Luxembourg Business Journal picked it as one of the most memorable cultural events in New York City in 2014 in their year in review.

We will cultivate our five senses in the best possible way through this event by 1) sipping red or white wine (taste & smell) ; 2) attending a beautiful live jazz concert featuring an internationally acclaimed jazz pianist (listen & see); 3) feeling the atmosphere of a new Steinway & Sons showroom filled with the most beautiful pianos you can ever imagine (feel & see); and 4) meeting equally nice and like minded people to share laughter and happiness. 


Please see the below details for further information.

Venue; Steinway & Sons Showroom: 

Steinway & Sons will open their main hall for us :)

The below pictures are from our last event with pianist Logan Evan Thomas.

Concert/ Jazz Artists: 


Nick Vayenas, band leader, trumpet & trombone (of Michael Buble Band). www.nickvayenas.com


Joseph Lepore, double bass http://www.josephleporemusic.com/josephlm/news

Dan Kaufman on Steinway D http://www.dankaufmanmusic.com

These musicians are going to play dreamy jazz songs such as 'Stardust' and 'My ship'. Please check out the following link for David Brubeck's version of 'Stardust': STARDUST 

**Note- Substitution of bassist: Joseph Lepore (Rome, Italy) will be on double bass instead of Peter Slavov.

Wine, Goat Cheese Ball and Cracker Social:

Wine: Pinot Noir, Rose and Chardonnay (chilled)

** Note for unique (moderate) wine lovers** 

The below three (3) wines will be available only per your request (One (1) glass limit, a requester should be at least twenty one (21) years old):

1. Domaine Marius Delarche Pernand-Vergelesses Blanc 2012


Pernand-Vergelesses is located near the great Grand Cru vineyard of Corton Charlemagne, and its wines offer similar (if less profound) characteristics at more modest cost. The 2012 Delarche Pernand Vergelesses Blanc offers elegant fruit, spice, mineral and oak character with good concentration and balance. Represents good value given its prestigious geography and terroir.


2. Vincent Girardin Santenay Les Charmes 2005

From the Burgundy village of Santenay, known for intense pinots, there is one that comes from these half-century old vines that may be better than them all. Vincent Girardin Santenay Les Charmes is described as smooth and easy, and all who drink it report tasting dark fruits like cherry in the finish. 

3. Chateau La Vieille Cure Fronsac 2004 

Robert Parker 90"As was the 2003, this is another big time sleeper of the vintage. The dense ruby/purple-tinged 2004 offers a sweet perfume of framboise, black cherry liqueur, cedar, and spice. Supple-textured, medium to full-bodied, expansive, and savory with superb purity and texture, it can be drunk now and over the next 10-12 years. This property has been on a qualitative roll and still remains one of Bordeaux s finest values."

PLUS....Goat Cheese Ball & Cracker Social

So is raw goat’s milk (and cheese) healthy?

As the Journal of American Medicine (JAMA) states, “Goat’s milk is the most complete food known.”


Cost:


Regular price (Final) is $14.00 and payment will be accepted via online only. No funds will be accepted at the door. If you prefer Paypal, here is the address for you-->[masked]. For the attendees who prefer unique wine choices (as described above), price is $20.00 and payment can be sent to-->[masked] via either Chase Quick Pay or Paypal. Plus here is another ticket link for you per your request: TICKET

PRICE INCLUDES:

Admission to the Steinway Showroom for three hours; escort by Steinway & Sons employees; seat (first come, first serve); 2 sets of live jazz concerts; Steinway Showroom tour (guided); wine (regular or unique) reception and goat cheese ball & crackers.

What makes this event even more special:

• there are no regular jazz and wine social events like this, it is created by me with the cooperation of Steinway & Sons!

How to get to Steinway Hall:

Two blocks from N,Q,R,B,D,F,M, 7 line, Time Square Station. Please click here for the map--->DIRECTION

See you guys soon, 

Angie.

P.S. Here is the links to our past meet up event at Steinway Hall for your reference:

http://www.meetup.com/winejazz/events/218656697/ 

http://www.meetup.com/winejazz/events/223862945/


P.P.S. I strongly recommend that you bring your camera or a cell phone with a camera to capture a memory at such a beautiful place.

results.description:
These bad 80s movies are so legendary you should already know about them. But just in case...


8 PM - Mac and Me is sort of ET for Dummies, but its main claim to fame is the spontaneous song and dance session in a McDonalds, which is probably the most egregious advertising seen in a movie that wasn't actually about selling toys. Seriously, the trailer is introduced by Ronald McDonald.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vNjACYfQlbI


10 PM - Howard the Duck is Spielberg's giganfic flop. The hero is from an alternate New York where everyone is a duck, but is otherwise the same. So basically he's just randomly a duck. With aliens chasing him. And a plucky 80s rocker chick. And a cameo in Guardians of the Galaxy. Yeah.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yeU4UlDWfKI


Please arrive between 7 and 8. Drinks and snacks are appreciated, but not required.
results.name: Mac and Me + Howard the Duck

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - SWIM + FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.name: Sorry FULL... Weekend Retreat - Hike, Swim, Bonfire & Fun in Mtns of PA!

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 7pm to around 11pm or so.

This week will be hosted by one of our newest members, R'el (short for Rachel). This party is BYOB (Bring Your Own Booze). We will probably order a few pizzas so if you want something else please bring it yourself. We will use the comments section below to coordinate.

The list is tentatively capped at 15 people due to space limitations but we won't leave anyone hanging!

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
InspiredWordNYC presents LAST FRIDAYZ @ Local Project, an event inspired by the epochal underground spirit of the long-gone Gaslight Café, SAMO, and Folk City.

A dynamic mix of music, live art (including face-painting), poetry, spoken word, and performance art (including human canvases) – with electrifying showcased artists – LAST FRIDAYZ will happen every last Friday of the month (except during the holiday season months of November and December) within one of NYC's great creative spaces, Local Project – a non-profit arts organization that for over a decade in Long Island City, Queens, has been committed to providing emerging artists with a space and educational forum.

ALL AGES WELCOME.

Social media hashtag: #LICLastFridayz

Prepare yourself to be blown away! Guaranteed epic nights!

Doors open @ 7pm, ends at midnight.

Tickets are available for $8 dollars online or $10 at the door.

$7 Early Bird Specials are available up to a week prior to the date. *Limited Availability*

InspiredWordNYC will donate $2 of every ticket sold to Local Project. There’s also a donation option on this page where you can donate whatever you'd like directly to this wonderful organization.

*****
Who: Produced by InspiredWordNYC
http://InspiredWordNYC.com

What: LAST FRIDAYZ showcase 

When: EVERY last Friday of the month, 7pm

Where: Local Project

http://www.localproject.org/

[masked]th Road (between 21st and 11th Street)Long Island City QueensTake E,M,G or 7 train to Court Square.

Why: Because we NEED great cultural events in Queens!

*****

Local Project is committed to building an educational forum for emerging artists of exceptional vision, and creating synergy between the exhibition of their work and the public. We believe diversity is essential to growth. Founded in 2003 by a group of Latin American artists and friends, LP is committed to offering year-round exhibitions, arts mentoring, and bilingual (Spanish/English) programming, while building bridges between Latino culture and other global communities. At LP, we support all forms of self-expression by providing an open space for artists of all genres, media, or provenances. LP provides a creative harbor for all, where artist and community can collaborate towards a richer and fuller development of both.
results.how_to_find_us: Advance Discounted Tickets @ https://lastfridayz.eventbrite.com
results.name: LAST FRIDAYZ @ Local Project - Music + Poetry + Spoken Word + Live Art
