results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Francisco/Silvia)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Friday 6:45pm Soccer @ Riverside (7v7) for PS2G

group.name: PS2G NYC-Coed Soccer Pickup for Charity -Play Soccer 2 Give

results.description:
Greetings Dear Friends!


This Pisces Full Moon will help us feel our inner divinity and inspired guidance (Pisces / Neptune) and ground it into practical service (Sun's in Virgo) for the greater good. Sharon and I will use our skills to help the group get in touch with abilities they may not be aware of and to fine tune talents that they've already developed and deploy them in new more effective ways. This event will include guided meditation, aura reading, releasing of blocks with energy healing, lunar node astrological interpretations and more. The exchange for this event is $45. Please rsvp by emailing me and include your birthdata - date, year, exact time of day if known, and location (town, state, country) so I can give you some counseling in the workshop based on your natal chart.


Some of you know Sharon Blauer from collaborations we've done in the past or from having been referred to her by friends. She's a wonderful healer and I love working with her! She'll be in town until the end of August when she'll go back home to Egypt. She has more than 20 yrs. experience as a professional healer, teacher, psychic, medium, hypnotist, singer etc.. Join us for the NY Shamanic Healing Circle with Irma StarSpirit Woman

The NY Shamanic Healing Circle meets about every last Friday of the month from 7 -9:30 pm

Dates for circle are: June 26, July 31st, Aug. 28, Sept. 25, Oct. 30, Nov. (No Circle) & Dec. 18.

Location: YoGanesh Yoga – 208 W. 29th St, 2nd Fl., #201 (btw. 7th & 8th Ave), NYC.(door closes at 7:30pm)

Exchange: $20

Register to hold space email: [masked]

We open new doors for personal and communal healing. Experience and practice a vast range of healing modalities. As we work, we allow ourselves to be “seen and heard’ by Spirit. Bring your worries, illness and dis-ease into a Sacred Space and allow your healing to manifest.

Please bring a drum or rattle.
Have extra socks for warm cozy feet, and a blanket or shawl for comfort, water.

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. Irma StarSpirit Woman currently lives in Queens, NY Contact her at [masked] or visit: shamanicfirereiki.com

Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 singles just like you in one FUN evening!

How does it work?

You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out!

Recommended ages: Men 25-38, Women 23-36

Tickets are $20 if you RSVP on our Meetup group / $40 at door without RSVP if space is available.


PS: We are promoting this event on several Asian professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone - we assure you we will have a good amount of men and women participate at our event.

minus5° is the premium ice attraction in the United States. The minus5 is located in the lobby of the New York Hilton Midtown on 6th Avenue and 53rd street.

Everything inside minus5° is made of ice; the walls, the bar, the seats and even the glasses that you enjoy your cocktails in. We have our own ice carver who creates the ice sculptures and continuously reinvents the experience throughout the year.

Once you choose your package, you’re kitted out with gloves and a warm parka or Faux Fur Coat, then transported into a winter wonderland of interactive ice architecture while sipping the coolest cocktails from glasses made entirely of ice. An exciting LED light show and upbeat music plays while you take in the pristine surroundings. The temperature is controlled and designed to provide a refreshing experience as you explore the different ice sculptures and themed ice rooms. Professional photographers are available to capture the memory and we offer a great line of hip merchandise and gear. 

The perfect place to experience that special birthday or anniversary and are available for private events and/or corporate buyouts

Lets come out and CHILL.  

Buy your ticket on the link below ( Choose the $45.00 two Cocktail Experience- Includes: Ice Bar Experience, 2 Specialty Ice Cocktails, Use of Parka, Gloves)

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them whenever and however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!


Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change 
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions 
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress 
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
Below is the synopsis of when and where the first campaign of The One Ring Roleplaying Game Group will begin. As it stands, we're out of table space for this session. Sign up for the waitlist if you're interested in playing. If enough folks sign up, we can schedule another session.

---

By the Stewards’ Reckoning, it is the month of Narquelië in the year 2956 of the third age of Middle-earth. In the Shire, in the west of Eriador, tales of Bilbo Baggins’ outlandish adventure to the Lonely Mountain and back with a company of dwarves and that meddlesome wizard, Gandalf, have passed into local legend, and life has settled back into its bucolic pace.

But elsewhere in Middle-earth, the fragile peace that followed the Battle of the Five Armies has begun to erode.

To the east, past the bounds of the Bree-land in the wilds of Eriador, the shadows that fell long ago when the Witch-king of Angmar waged war on the last men of Númenor continue to deepen. Fell creatures inhabiting the ruins of the Kingdom of Arnor beckon for their kin from the Misty Mountains and beyond to join them.

Further east still, in Wilderland, it is rumored that servants of the enemy have taken up dominion yet again in Southern Mirkwood.

The Dúnedain remaining in Eriador are ever vigilant. But, with their diminishing numbers, can they keep the growing shadow at bay? Or, has the time come to forge new alliances to ensure that the failings of ages past do not come to pass once again in the third age of the sun?
results.name: And so it begins...

Sorry this meetup is full!!!


The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Relaxing Night Walk. Enjoy a quiet evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - SWIM + FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake. Chill in the warm Shallow Lake water. Bringing POOL Floaties, Pool Lounge, Swim Rings etc. Then WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

results.description:
Thank you to everyone who came to our last Game Night!  It was heaps of fun and conquest!   :)

We hope you join us on our next Game Night for a chance to meet tons of new people, play some great games, and drink a few beers. And make sure to invite your friends! We'll have Jamaican/Caribbean dominoes as well. This is one of our favorite strategy games and we would love to share it with the experienced and inexperienced alike.

In addition to dominoes, we will have Settlers of Catan, King of Tokyo, BANG!, Cards Against Humanity, and others. If you'd like to bring your own games, there will be lots of people who like to learn new games.  And again, all are welcome!

Also make sure to bring some cash for a donation.  Though donations are not required, if you are able to donate we suggest $5 for gaming and $5-10 if you're drinking and gaming. Organizing this is 100% volunteer and all the money goes to this MU page, refreshments, and renting the space.  

We do not provide food, but there are lots of take-out and delivery options nearby.

See you there!!

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!!  No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed.  Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated.   If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**


In parallel with OPEN CRAFT NIGHT:

Come on down and make stuff! Don't be shy, we love seeing new faces and meeting new MakerBarbians. Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, WARNING spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive!

Let's try a new place this time, amazing 66 !

CASH Only No exception! ( make organizer Job easier! Do not show up with credit card please!) 


• Serious RSVP only. Do not RSVP if you're not certain. 

• "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated.

• There will be a $3.00 meetup fee and will be added to your bill.

• We are going to eat Family Style, each person orders one dish to share. We will split the final bill of food. Every individual is responsible to pay their own drinks.

• Cash Only. Very important!!! Makes everyone's life easier...

•  Most restaurant only keep reservation for 15 minutes, so if you are late for more than 15 minutes,The restaurant might take the seat away ( I will do my best to keep it for you , but if restaurant insist there is nothing I can do about it )  so try to be on time please. Thank You. 

• Do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above.


The Cost of Food without Drink should be around $25-$33 per person (could been more or less ) , No including Drinks 

http://newyork.seriouseats.com/2009/11/amazing-66-a-truly-amazing-menu-in-manhattans-chinatown-nyc-review.html

Yelp link

http://www.yelp.com/biz/amazing-66-new-york

results.description:
Come join us for our monthly Game Night. Food, drink, fun times and good people!

We typically play party games like Apple to Apples, Cranium, Taboo and Scattegrories first and end with a charades like game called Celebrity.  If you have a group game you think people would like, please feel free to bring it.

I provide some light snacks and drinks but feel free to bring something to share with the group.  We also give out silly "prizes" to the winners so if you would like to donate to the grab bag that can work out as well!  Prizes can be a piece of candy or a silly dollar store item.

*Don't fret if you are on the waiting list. People tend to drop out (especially a day or so before) so keep on the lookout. You most likely will end up able to come!!
results.name: Game Night

results.description:
Dear Friends, please join us to celebrate my company's 20,000 members milestone.

There will be good live music, free food and drinks.

Guitar Live Music will be performed by Chaz.

Violin Live Music will be performed by Sophie.

FREE ADMISSION, this special occasion only happens only once per year.

Dress Code: Business Casual, Look Your Best, No Sneakers.

A Canon DSLR photographer will be available to take photos for all guests upon your request. Here are some photos from Previous Events:

Thank you for celebrating together with us. 

During the event, we will speak for about 30 minutes to introduce a famous artist from China and going over volunteering opportunities to help Business Owners in New York City.

Friends from 17 business groups will be attending this event. 
Please RSVP for this event now. 

Thank You. 
James, Director of Information Technology 
NYC Business Owners Network, Webspert Corporation

results.description:
Over and over and over. We are on auto pilot now, so we will have this, or another event, at a place to be determined, (TBI), every two weeks, with a pancake or some other panic event tossed in to keep everyone aggravated to the fullest.

As usual, if you RSVP 'yes' but can't make it, call me; your merry group organizer, Greg, at[masked] 1066.

And the standard 'It's ok to come late, or bring well behaved young ones' is in effect as well. 

Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 12AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.
results.how_to_find_us: if in a panic, call my cell! 201 621 1066 ask for Greg.

results.description:
Holistic Healing With Music & Sound With Music Therapist Julie Sherwood M.A., MT-BC, LCAT. Board Certified Music Therapist, Licensed Creative Arts Psychotherapist,

Music and sound have been recognized as powerful healing agents since ancient times, and the formal practice of Music Therapy has been broadly researched and strictly regulated in the United States for nearly 60 years. Music Therapy & Sound Healing are proven to alleviate anxiety and insomnia, relieve acute pain and chronic pain conditions, speed healing of physical injuries and illness, release energy blockages, promote entry into altered states where limiting beliefs can be transformed and Higher Wisdom easily accessed, deepen meditation and spiritual practices, and much more. Profound results can be achieved with these gentle, pleasurable, easily accessible practices.

Join us to:

· Gain a greater understanding of the science behind Music Therapy and Sound Healing

· Experience group healing with sound and music
· Leave empowered with techniques you can use at home for relaxation, pain relief and more No musical knowledge or background is necessary to benefit from these experiences or to master self-healing techniques.

Julie Sherwood, M.A., MT-BC, LCAT is a Board Certified Music Therapist, Licensed Creative Arts Psychotherapist, Body-Centered Psychotherapist, and Energy Medicine practitioner. For the past 20 years Julie has practiced a broad range of mind/body therapies, integrating them into her unique approach to Music Therapy and Sound Healing. She is passionate about using music to help people everywhere raise their consciousness, transform their thoughts and feelings, and awaken to a deeper sense of health, happiness, and inner harmony.
results.name: Holistic Healing With Music & Sound With Music Therapist Julie Sherwood

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

results.description:
Sorry this meetup is full!!!

The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/


http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups (over 20)!!! Therefore, RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... SWIM... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Relaxing Night Walk. Enjoy a quiet evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - SWIM + FIREPLACE: 

Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.name: Sorry, Full... Hike + Swim + Bonfire + Party + Fun Activities in Mtns of PA!!!

venue.address_1: Coney Island Ave. and Brighton Beach Ave.
venue.name: Brighton Beach Ave. and Coney Island Ave., Southeast corner

results.description:
The shore and boardwalk in Brighton Beach and Coney Island are magical (and pleasantly cool) at night, especially with the full moon reflecting on the water. We'll start by grabbing a takeout snack or quick meal at NYC's biggest and most exotic "salad" bar (far more than salads), part of a Russian mega-market. (Even if you bring your own snack, exploring this store is an adventure.) We'll walk along the boardwalk and shore through Brighton and Coney, viewing the nightlife (including Coney's new Luna Park) and the clusters of dolled-up Russians on the Brighton boards. At 9:30 we'll watch the fireworks from a long pier! Come and enjoy being on this distant planet, light years from the conventional city.

DISTANCE: About 4 miles.

ENDING TIME: Probably around 10:15. But you can leave earlier, of course.

TRANSPORTATION: B or Q train to Brighton Beach station. For more details, consult hopstop.com, mta.tripplanner.org, or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate.

COST: $1 (50% off!!), in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee; plus the cost of any food you buy.

W PLEASE NOTE: Wear suitable shoes for walking on the beach and shore.
results.how_to_find_us: The corner is a big intersection a little east of the B/Q train. (East is toward the bend in Brighton Beach Ave. South is toward the boardwalk, visible from any corner. ) There's a big Chase bank on the SE corner. I'll be wearing a red hat.
results.name: Brooklyn boardwalk (sunset, full moon, fireworks, & food!)

The LOFT group is for women who identify as lesbian.

The group's emphasis is on socializing, making friends, and having fun in a self-affirming environment for lesbians. We also plan outings get off-site in between meetings at The LOFT, often joining in with our entire LGBT family on various LOFT outings. 

We meet every 2nd and 4th Friday at The LOFT, 7:30pm-9:00pm

results.description:
Host 4 This Meetup: Beau

Join a bunch of singles from multiple Meetup groups as we casually stroll along a 1.5-mile stretch of waterfront in Hoboken. Afterwards we'll have a few drinks and chit chat at Pier 13. Pier 13 has amazing views of the NYC skyline as well as awesome food truck options and drinks galore! 

Check out the pics from the last time we did this. We had an amazing time! My walks always bring out the most beautiful people! 

We will meet at 7:30 PM in front of Caffebene located at 79 Hudson Street, Hoboken, NJ 07030. The walk will start at exactly 8 PM so do not be late or you will miss us. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of Caffebene and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure (and you shouldn't be) you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend/non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. Every 10 minutes or so I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken to yet so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter
results.name: Hoboken Sunset Singles Stroll + Drinks at Pier 13 | Age: 21 to 49

We will meet at 7:30 PM in front of Caffebene located at 79 Hudson Street, Hoboken, NJ 07030. The walk will start at exactly 8 PM so do not be late or you will miss us. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of Caffebene and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure (and you shouldn't be) you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend/non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. Every 10 minutes or so I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken to yet so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. 


Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter
results.name: Hoboken Sunset Singles Stroll + Drinks at Pier 13 | Age: 21 to 49

group.name: Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special

results.description:
Friday night is the evening we get to meet to study the Bible together. We do this 1 - 2 times a month. I've been blessed by the surge of interest in this meetup.  We're a small group of Christians who like to study the Bible.  We're studying the gospel of John.  Lord willing, we will be starting in on John 4 and progressing as the Spirit leads. We love discussion and sometimes don't get over many verses.  The only prerequisite for RSVP'ing for this meetup is a love for studying the Bible and if you have that, you will enjoy your time. I would like to encourage you recent signups to RSVP and come. Also there are a bunch of you other Christians out there who haven't made it yet. Just RSVP and come.  How else will you know if you like it or not?  It's free and it's inspirational.

The meetup is held in the basement of a church we rent for the occasion located at: 42 E 5th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11218.  It's in a quiet community with plenty of curbside parking available and just across the pedestrian bridge from the Fort Hamilton Pkwy F & G train stop.  We meet at 7:30 and spend about 1.5 hrs together.

We're looking for a good time of learning from God's Word together.  God's blessings to you.  We're looking forward to seeing you at the meetup.
results.name: We will be looking into Gospel of John chapter 4 and discussing the passage

group.name: Brooklyn Prayer & Bible Study with Mennonites

results.description:
Ever wonder what it’s like to do permaculture in India or Southeast Asia?

Rico Zook knows. He’s been working internationally for over 30 years and has an encyclopedic knowledge of plants. This will be Rico’s only NYC appearance en route to the 2015 IPC in London. Come watch and listen as Rico shares pictures and anecdotes about his life and travels as an itinerant permaculture designer and teacher. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to see Rico in person!

Friday, August 28th: 7:30 to 9 pm. Please RSVP to attend. 

Open to the Public: Suggested Donation $10 - $20

For more information visit: http://www.beyondorganicdesign.org/rico-zook-working-successfully-in-different-cultures.html

Whether you are a tournament player or a “newbie,” if you love making friends while playing the world's #1 Word Game, SCRABBLE, as we do then…

•   Come On Down!

      •   Bring A Guest! 

          •   Feel free to bring your Scrabble set and

               • Enjoy the night with us!

We normally meet EVERY 2ND AND 4TH FRIDAY

                         • EATING starts AT 7:30PM
              (whether it's dinner or just dessert/drinks)

            • GAMES START NO LATER THAN 8:15 PM.

In addition, (after an initial round of “Scrabble”) THE 4TH WEEK OF EVERY MONTH, we enjoy TEAM TRIVIA, pitting two teams of those who want to play against each other in a battle of wits over totally insignificant information.

(Those who are not trivia aficionados continue their Scrabble competition.)

Afterward, for those who want to hang and chill, we play a short group game, chosen at random. (TABOO has been the latest "hot choice.")

ABOVE ALL, WE HAVE ONE HOUSE RULE—

                          LET FUN BE #1!!!

RSVPs open 3 days prior to event. 

Please pay online by game time.
If you don't get the payment prompt from Meetup, you can send a paypal payment of $15 to [masked].

Friday Night Meetups begin at 8pm and end at 10:30

This evening is for Beginners-to-Intermediate. Perfect for folks new to the group. RSVPS open at 12:30 noon on Tuesdays! 

Come out, get a great workout and make new friends!!

GAME RULES:

-On serves only one REDO will be granted per player per game on first serve. (Can hit any obstacle (except lighting) and ball cannot be going out of bounds on sides) After a successful serve(s), no redos! (Beneficial to players waiting to sub in)

- NO REDOS on ceiling obstacles only on WIRE (less arguing, will speed up games)

-If each team fouls they both will cancel each other and a redo will be played immediately 

-No Net touches top or bottom (For Safety of all players)

results.description:
This group meets on the 4th Friday of each month to discuss various works of "modern" masters or upcoming talent in SF, fantasy, paranormal, horror and related genres. It also occasionally explores classics and the 'masters' of the classics.

Still mourning the loss of his wife, fallen angel Remy Chandler has immersed himself in investigating dangerous supernatural cases. His latest: the theft of a cache of ancient weaponry stolen from a collector who deals in antiquities of a dark and dubious nature. The weapons, Remy knows, were forged eons ago and imbued with unimaginable power. And if they fall into the wrong hands, they could be used to destroy not only Heaven but also Earth.

results.description:
In a post-epidemic nightmare world, scientist Robert Morgan (Vincent Price) is the only man immune to the plague which has transformed the entire population of the Earth into vampire-like creatures. He becomes the monster slayer that vampire-society fears. Curing one of them, Ruth (Franca Bettoja), with a transfusion of his blood gives him hope for the future. It is a short future, however, since the other vampires quickly find and kill him. This dark tale, based on Richard Matheson's even darker novel "I Am Legend," was later remade as The Omega Man with Charlton Heston in the Vincent Pricerole.

results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed:
- In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what you signed up for, I need that to keep track! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun!

results.description:
Sign-up link for the webinar is here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/webinars?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
results.name: An Introduction to Inner Engineering--FREE Class (Online Webinar)

results.description:
Do you know your reefer rights?

We are a cross-disciplinary coalition of radical artists, social media experts and grassroots organizers from the Occupy Wall Street community of NYC who have teamed up with drug policy experts from the Empire State Chapter of the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML) to become the militant wing of the marijuana legalization community of NYC. 

Governor Cuomo's Compassionate Care Act is a deadly insult. Progressive leaders in Albany like Senator Liz Krueger tells us that it will be at least another half decade before her Marijuana Regulation and Taxation Act will have a chance of passing the senate floor. We find this unacceptable.

Meet Up with us every Friday night for some free appetizers courtesy of Open Cannabis and free education on how to safely stay high and get by without getting busted while we organize and creatively fight for legal recreational cannabis in NYC.

results.name: Occupy Your Cannabis Rights Right Now!

Hoff's Horrorfest is a free monthly show hosted by Hoff Matthews, featuring stand-up from Hoff and a guest performer followed by a horror movie screening. The guest this month is the hilarious Cathy Humes, and this month's movie is the 2001 H. P. Lovecraft adaptation DAGON, a story of an isolated Spanish fishing village with a dark supernatural secret. It's from Stuart Gordon, the guy who did RE-ANIMATOR, so you know it's going to be a good time.

The show starts at 9:30pm on Friday, August 28th, at Brit Pack (34 Pell St. in Manhattan). It's free and BYOB. Here's the event page: http://hoffmatthews.com/2015/08/13/hoffs-horrorfest-presents-dagon-featuring-cathy-humes/ See you there!

results.description:
Location[masked]th Ave,Queens,New York 11102 Venue Bohemian Beer Garden Time 10:00 PM - 2:00 AM Price $5 - $10 Online | $15 @ the door
Quiet Clubbing invades the famous Bohemian Hall Beer Garden in Astoria. Hundreds of people, tons of drinks, 3 DJs, and one crazy party outdoors!

This prime clubbing spot we exploit because of NYC’s noise ordinance on loud music after 10pm, but NOT TONIGHT! The party kicks off at 10pm when the headphones go on and DJs take the stage. They’ll be spinning everything to keep you singing, drinking and dancing till 2am!

DJ 1 (Blue) – Hip Hop / R&B
DJ 2 (Red) – 80’s, 90’s, 2K and Old School hits
DJ 3 (Green) – Top 40, EDM, and Crowd favorites

Never been to a Quiet Clubbing Event? Watch our YouTube video to learn why everyone is talking about it.

Age: 21+

Get your tickets here: http://quietevents.electrostub.com/event.cfm?cart&id=149115

HOW IT WORKS

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmFLSpLOXvo
results.name: $5 Beer Garden Party in Astoria

results.description:
Everyone being put on a WAITING LIST (this allows me to screen participants based on their responses to the questions - I will change the RSVP to YES of those that are going)

For Advanced hikers only.


If you finish The Great Range Traverse you'll proud of yourself. Many traverse attempts has been terminated for different reason.  


You have to be prepared to hike alone and know your way out if you unable to keep up with group. 

GEAR: if you don't know what to bring, you are in way over your head. 


EXTREMELY DIFFICULT HIKE.


Please read the description carefully before signing up, if you are not sure about how difficult this is, please email me  so we can talk about details. This is a serious marathon climb with huge mileage in a day, monster elevation change and exposed, fun rock scrambling and we are doing it at a fast pace, .


* We are doing a Great Range Traverse in the Adirondacks, we will hit all the 8 high peaks in the range, with a total mileage about 24 miles and with 9500'elevation gain, this trip will be well-planned with a fast pace and minimal stops, you have to be a fast hiker averaging at least 2miles/hour.  The goal is to have fun and challenge ourselves and NOT get injured. 

*You may plan and hike your personal shorter option: 
Marsy & Haystacks,  Marsy & Haystacks & Basin & Saddleback, Gothics & Armstrong & Upper WolfJaw etc.

Stay Friday Night: <a>http:// </a><a>href="http://www.keenevalleyhostel.com/rates.html">www.keenevalleyhostel.com/rates.html</a> $25 per person. 


This is rated as the 3rd hardest day hike in the USA (for me personally it is hardest in the NE), it also has extremely long, steep and exposed rock climbing and cliff climbing, so you must be in extremely good shape. Most of the range does not have water source, so you have to bring all your water (5-6 liters) ,  bring a water filter to re-fill along the way, refer to the map for water source. 


Our target time is 14 hours for the 24 miles, what we will do is check our progress at each peak and decide the next step.

You must have exactly $7 in cash to pay for day parking at the Garden Parking Lot for Saturday. We will start hiking from the Garden Trailhead at 4:30AM sharp. 


You will need day hike gears, headlight, 2 pair of socks, clean clothes, plenty of food for the day. Itinerary & Target Time (include rest, food, photo): 

The Plan:

4:00 Meeting at Rooster Comb trailhead   [masked], [masked]

Spot the car at Rooster Comb trailhead

Drive to Garden Trailhead  [masked], [masked]

4:30 Start hike from Garden Trailhead  [masked], [masked]

Garden Trailhead to Mt. Marcy (1): 9.1 miles, 3820 feet gain, 4h.
Mt. Marcy to Mt. Haystack (2): 2.4 miles, gain 2400 feet, loss 450 feet, 1.5h.
Haystack to Mt. Basin (3) (we will get water here): 2 miles, gain 1500 feet, loss 1000 feet. 1.5h.
Basin to Mt. Saddleback (4) (cliff climbing): 1mile, gain 1000, loss 500, 40min.
Saddleback to Mt. Gothics (5) (exposed rock scramble): 1.6 mile, gain 1000, loss 1000, 1.5h.
Gothics to Armstrong (6), Upper Wolfjaw (7): 2.8 mile, gain 1800, loss 1200, 2.5h.
At this point we have 4.8 miles to go back to the parking lot. We will assess to see if we can do Lower Wolfjaw (8), 1 mile, +800, -600. Our target is to leave at 5:00AM and return to the car by 7:30PM. We do have options to bail out at about 70% point. Questions feel free to ask.

 There is cell phone reception at peaks, so definitely bring your phones.

This hike is weather-dependent. If there is rain or t-storms in the forecast, we'll do an alternate hike that day.


+++++++++++++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Who's up for a drive upstate, to do some whitewater tubing and eat awesome food?  We went last summer, and it was a great time! *FYI, this might be changed to the following weekend if the water level in the river is low, there will be a release of water from the dam the following weekend.*

We'll gather in Mt. Vernon and carpool (easily Metro-North accessible via the Harlem Line), so just post in comments if you need a ride.

From there we'll take a scenic drive up to the Catskills, have brunch, and go tubing down the Esopus river.  Most restaurants in town run about $10 per entree.  Tubing will cost between $20-50, depending on what you rent in addition to your tube.  Please bring a swimsuit and shoes that strap to your feet, if you are wearing regular flip-flops they will make you rent protective foot cover that won't fall off.  There are rapids, depending on the water level in the river it could be a really wild ride so losing things is an issue.  Teva-type sandals or old cloth sneakers are probably best bets. Also, if you wear glasses bring some kind of strap for them or they will make you buy/rent one, and if you want to bring some water for the trip down the river bring a piece of string or something that you can use to tie it to your tube.

For those interested in seeing the sites in town, there is a little downtown strip which has antique shops, a farmer's market, and other such things.  The Empire State Railway Museum is also in town.

results.description:
This meetup is full, please send me a message if you would like to do the same trip on Sunday. On Saturday we are going to the North-South Lake Campground in Catskills. It is time to hike and run on some real mountains! We'll get up to almost 4000 ft. 

I can pick you up in NYC and we'll carpool all together in our RawMobile. As you can see, the number of spots is very limited, so first come first serve. The details about pick up and drop off are below. To reserve a spot just RSVP to this meetup.


Our recent day trips to the Catskills were awesome, so we're doing it again. Some folks were running, some were hiking, but all had fun and made new friends. Check out our photos and comments from the past trips.


There are lots of ways to enjoy a day at North-South Lake Campground, but the main point of interest to us is probably the famous Escarpment Trail. If you have never heard of this trail, take a look here: http://escarpmenttrail.com/ This is one of the most beautiful places for hiking and trail running in New York state.

Here is a video from the 2013 Escarpment  Trail race:

https://vimeo.com/71310538

Please note that we are not doing the entire trail (if you really want to do all 19 miles, let me know and we'll figure out how to set it up). Also, if you're interested on doing this trip on Sunday, let me know. 

I  will get you there and back and will take care of the day pass to the campground, and also we'll have lots of fruit and bottled water for everyone. We'll also have few picnic/beach  blankets. 

We will start hiking/running at North-South lake campground. I suggest doing about 5 miles of the trail (to the crashed airplane, or maybe a bit further), and then turning around. I will be staying at the back of the group, and faster hikers/runners can go ahead of us if they want to.


The beauty of this plan is that it's impossible to get lost. The trail is VERY EASY TO FOLLOW (it is well-marked with blue markers) so you can go at your own pace and turn around when you feel like it. Just be sure to get back on time before we leave (5pm sharp).


You are welcome to hike with anyone else in the group, but all abilities are welcome and everyone can enjoy this trail at their own pace.  The trail is rugged and at times very steep. Please prepare accordingly. There is no any water on the trail, so be sure to have enough with you. On weekends there are lots of people hiking there, so we certainly won't be alone there.

Other activities that you might choose to enjoy during our trip to the campground:


- hiking around the lake,


- visiting scenic spot of Mountain House,


- renting a boat (availability might be limited),


- lake swimming (in the designated area),


- suntanning and enjoying the beach.

More information about the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/outdoor/24487.html


Map of the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/docs/permits_ej_operations_pdf/northsouthlake2015.pdf

There are nice showers and bathrooms right by the beach (which is also our parking area and starting/finishing point of the hike/run). There are also picnic areas with tables and benches all around the beach.



What to bring (optional):

Towel, clean clothes, flip-flops, gels, your favorite snack, map, insects repellent, rain jacket.


You will be able to leave your extra stuff in the car if needed.


Pick up/Drop off:

The main point of the pick up is bus station by GW Bridge (at 8 am sharp!). To get there you can take A train (to 175th street). 


The drive takes just over 2 hours, we'll leave NYC at 8am, get to the lake shortly after 10am, run, eat, enjoy the beach, and head out back to the city by 5pm. We'll be back in NYC shortly after 7pm.

If you don't need a ride, then just come over to the campground and meet us there, no need to RSVP here.


Bad weather cancels the trip! Please check this meetup for the updates a day before.

Cell reception: T-mobile doesn't work there. AT&T mostly does work. Not sure about the others.

Time to go to the mountains!

Legal Disclaimer
results.name: Day Trip to Catskills (NYC pick up and drop off). Famous Escarpment Trail, lake

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>
results.name: Tennis Social

results.description:
Come join us for a Fun-Filled day in the Adirondacks!

WE WILL MEET at the Owl Head Lookout Trailhead and Parking Area off Route 9n.


[masked], [masked]


WE WILL FINISH AT the Roostercomb Parking area at 1730 Route 73 in Keene Valley where I will have 1 car spotted that can hold up to 4 people. If we get more attendees I might need a volunteer to help spot another car before the hike.

[masked], [masked]

Our plan pending good weather will be a Traverse from Owl Head Lookout to Hopkins Mountain with an out and back up the rear access to Giant Mountain (46er). It will be a long day and the group will be expected to move at a decent pace of at least 1 mph uphill and 2 mph on level or downhill terrain. http://www.lakeplacid.com/do/hiking/owl-head-lookout


http://www.lakeplacid.com/do/hiking/giant-mountain



Distance: Approximately 14 miles

Hiking Pace: up to 2.0 mph

Estimated Hike Time: 10 hours

Difficulty: Intermediate - Rocky Terrain, steep Ascents and Descents some of which may require the use of Ladders

Current Weather Forecast:  ??


RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Shoes with good grip

• Gaiters

• A Backpack - with Raincoat/Windbreaker

• Hiking Poles

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, Lunch, First Aid, Headlamp, Sun Protection, Bug Spray, etc.


RELATED MAPS:

Adirondack Park - Lake Placid / High Peaks Trail Map #742

After our hike we will have the option of heading over to the Baxter Mountain Tavern for some Dinner, Drinks and Desserts!

Baxter Mountain Tavern & Grill

10050 NYS Rt. 9n

Keene, NY 12942

Phone[masked]

Website http://www.baxtermountaintavern.com/home.html

Nestled in the heart of  New York States historic Adirondack Parks High Peaks region, just 2 miles off the main route to the Olympic village of Lake Placid, you will find a memorable dining experience. The Baxter Mountain Tavern is a real Adirondack gem, a rustic restaurant featuring classic American cuisine with a warm family atmosphere. Since the doors opened in 1997, owner Dave Deyo has greeted the public with a welcome alternative to the hustle and bustle of urban life.

Located in Keene, home to over 30 of the regions highest peaks and minutes from several trail heads, the Baxter Mountain Tavern is a popular and picturesque spot. Pull up in a Adirondack chair on our spacious outdoor deck with glorious mountain views for cocktails and relaxation with friends. During the colder months, curl up on comfortable fireside couch with a locally brewed Lake Placid Ale. 


WHERE TO STAY?

I will be driving up early Friday and plan to hike both Friday and Sunday in addition to our Saturday Hike. I will be staying the whole weekend at:

Schultes Family Lodge

5866 Cascade Road

Lake Placid, NY 12946

Phone:[masked]

Website: http://www.schulteslodge.com/

For a cheaper place to stay I would also recommend checking out some of the area Hostels which include:

Tmax-n-Topo's Hostel


5046 Cascade Road

Lake Placid, NY 12946

Phone:[masked]

e-mail: [masked]

Website: http://www.tmax-n-topo.com/

or you also might want to check out:

Keene Valley Hostel
Jake & Robin
1755 NYS Route 73
PO Box 541
Keene Valley, NY  12943

Phone:[masked]

e-mail: [masked]

Website: http://www.keenevalleyhostel.com/home.html


Adirondack Hiking maximum group size limitations:

• A group size limit of 15 people for day hiking is in place. Any group larger than 15 must split up (by no less than 1 mile) into smaller, self-sufficient groups that satisfy the size requirement. These groups shall not congregate into one large group at trail junctions, rest stops, lunch breaks, etc.


**HEAVY RAIN WILL CANCEL THIS EVENT**


NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The NYC Hiking & Outdoor Adventure Group does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
Just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.
results.name: Saturday soccer @ 8:30AM

results.description:
Event: Let's get together and visit Constitution island. We'll learn about island's revolutionary war, observe revolutionary war setting, and Re-Enactment scenes, we'll view Warner garden and we'll hike thru small hills and flat terrain. Please, order your tickets for constitution island admission in advance at this link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/re-enactment-day-tickets-17765379729
Then we'll visit the village of Cold spring, located in the Hudson highlands, sits at the deepest point of the Hudson River, directly across from West Point.
We’ll stroll thru historic district of village which is now on the national register of historic places. Then we’ll take a legendary trolley to Boscobel - federal style mansion, home of States Morris Dyckman. (if time will allow) The address: 1601 Route 9D (Bear Mountain Highway) in Garrison, NY, 10524
Meeting time and place:
“Meet me under the clock” of the Grand Central Terminal Station information booth, located in the main concourse area at 8:30am or 10:02 at Cold Spring train station. There will be a vans to take us to Constitution island
I suggest arriving at Grand Central station at 8:30am so you'll have time to buy your ticket (there is often a line).
We have to get 8:43am metro-north rail road tickets to Cold Spring station NY.
We will aim for the 5:00pm train from Cold Spring village back to Grand Central Terminal.
My cell #[masked]
Cost: metro-north rail road is about $25 
Constitution island is $10
Boscobel tour is $10 (optional)
Car drivers:
Please, write in your RSVP if you are driving and from where and if you're willing to offer a ride to fellow hikers
We'll meet at the Cold Spring Station at 10:02am
Definitely, it will be a great getaway and a chance to see the best scenery of Hudson valley

Please, wear the proper shoes and attire for a hike. (No high heels etc.) Please, bring water and bug repellent. Also, somewhere along the way, we'll have a small picnic, so bring snacks or light picnic food. In Cold Spring we'll try  delicious ice cream or sit and eat somewhere at small local restaurants.
results.name: Constitution island, Village of Cold Spring, Hudson Valley

results.description: We are now doing our Brooklyn runs on Saturdays.  We'll try to mix up the routes as much as possible so we don't get too bored doing lops of Prospect Park.  This will mainly serve as an opportunity for a long run.  If you have any ideas for courses, please let us know!
results.name: Brooklyn Weekend Run

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
