results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Dear Volunteer,

 Arthur Ashe Kids' Day (AAKD), presented by Hess, is just around the corner and we hope that you will be able to join us for another exciting year of tennis and entertainment. AAKD is Saturday, August 29th, from 9:30am-3pm. We hope to have great weather and an attendance of over 30,000 people as in years past. We fully expect another record breaking day of interactive games and activities for children and adults, along with the stadium show featuring great musical talent and the best tennis players in the world!

  Our 500 volunteers play an important role – especially during the morning activities. About 13 courts are staffed with enthusiastic teaching professionals and volunteers to assist them. Volunteers will help with activities such as monitoring the flow of participants, supervising court safety, managing prize giveaways, and assisting with pick up of balls and equipment. There is a large need for volunteers to also assist on off-court activities and around the grounds for various tasks throughout the day – this may include handing out maps, distributing hats, conducting surveys, giving directions or assistance, monitoring crowds, helping with contests and other interactive games.

 To apply to be a volunteer, please follow this simple process:

2)  Please make sure to print the Liability Waiver provided in the registration form. Complete the requested information and mail the original form back to the USTA.

(mark you are referred by me and that you are part of the group NYCnonprofit or the American Volunteers, so that we can be in the same area)

Greg

results.description:
Ever dreamt about going abroad to empower and inspire struggling communities? Are you concerned that your development work be culturally relevant but aren’t quite sure how to go about it? Rico Zook knows. He’s spent the last 15 years living and working in India and Southeast Asia.

Many of us want to help others live on our planet in a better way. Those who have the money, time, and desire can help. But good intentions are only a start. Problems arise when cultures conflict.

Rico can show you how to avoid the pitfalls if you’re doing permaculture or grassroots development abroad. From ethics to practical steps, you’ll learn how to successfully navigate a complex and changing world.

So whether you’re digging a ditch or building a community, let Rico give you the tools to become an agent for change. 

Subjects covered include: 
- Ethics of Working in a Foreign Culture 
- What is Itinerant Permaculture 
- Working and Teaching at Diverse Sites 
- Strategies for Successful Project Work 
- Course Strategies for Farmer Trainings 
- New Paradigms for Teaching 
- How to Start Working Internationally 
- Who to Work with 
- What to Pack 
- Tools of the Trade 
- Philosophy of The Road 
- Road Logistics

Rico Zook is an ecological designer, land consultant, and permaculture educator who's worked with farmers, villagers, and other locals in India, Cambodia, and the Mideast. He’s helped indigenous cultures preserve traditional knowledge and technologies while adapting to our rapidly globalizing world. Currently, Rico is developing sustainability demonstration sites and wetlands restoration in India and Southeast Asia.

NEW Sliding Scale Cost: $140 - $240 

Register NOW at BeyondOrganicDesign.com: http://bit.ly/1IiZaY5. A limited number of applicants will be accepted. 

Friday, August 28, 7:30 pm: Rico Zook will hold a slideshow of his work on permaculture in Southeast Asia and India. Open to the public (suggested donation $10 - $20 for slideshow ONLY).

results.description:
Want to train the easy way for a 5K, all under the supervision of a certified personal trainer and while enjoying the beauty that nature has to offer?

Try this Meetup! We meet on Saturdays at 8:00 A.M. at the reservoir for an easy interval run. We will train for the Heroes and Villains 5K on October 3! This is a PROGRESSIVE run - meaning it is going to become more challenging over a period of 8 weeks before reverting back to 20-minute intervals again.

Why intervals? Why don't we just run the whole reservoir?

Interval training is easier on your joints and burns more fat than traditional running, and it will help new runners prepare for a 5K with less stress on the body.

Check out this article from Women's Health Magazine for more of the science behind interval running.

But I don't run (or haven't run in a long time)!

This is an easy, gentle run for women who are building their confidence/endurance as runners, or for women who are experienced runners who want to mix up their long-distance training with interval-training maintenance. Everyone can go at their own pace.

Some Housekeeping

Please RSVP by 8:00 P.M. the previous night if you plan on attending, so that you can get the best experience out of this running routine. You can also bring up to two friends, and please indicate this in your RSVP. Thanks!

Try to eat a banana or apple when you wake up for this Meetup - it will help your energy levels!

There is no place to leave bags/purses/wallets. Only bring what you can carry!

See you at the reservoir, ladies!

~ Rachel

meetup.com: $144
domain name: $15
clincher balls: $300

results.description:
Our 4th and final Delaware trip of the season!

Free CAMP & EVENT! Rain or Shine


All levels are welcome but you must have kayaked before! 

- Make sure you have breakfast before you come or bring snacks

- Also bring a sandwich or a lunch box


- Please manage to be on time 9:30am sharp on Saturday
- Most Cell. phone get no reception in the area
- Bring a ziplock bag to keep your items dry

(Kayaking for about 13 miles slow pace and there will be 4 rapids to face on the way all different levels 1 to 3)


After, we will take off to Akim's place to set up the camp.

(6 Acre property with a stream and waterfall and surrounded by 100s of acres of nature)

Camping & Bonfire  / Potluck (Bring whatever you may wish to share)

"You must be a member to attend"

Party ends Sunday 10:00am (or if you would like you can join us for Tubing Sunday)


River Map:  http://www.landersrivertrips.com/map.html


Organizer: Akim Elanbassi

Tel. [masked] (Call only ….. No texting )

Need to Rent a Kayak:

Aurora and Trouble have a few kayaks available. $50 each. Comes with paddle and life jacket. Drop off and pickup of kayaks included. Aurora will have these at the launch site. Contact him to reserve:

A.(Toni)Au­rora or call him @ 845 -[masked]

Once Aurora is out of Kayaks then you can call this place in Delaware:


LANDER'S River Trips and make your own reservation!
(located on the river at our take off and at our final destination)

1.800 . 252 . 3925

For more info about rental:

http://www.landersrivertrips.com/kayaking.html


Att:

SPOTS ARE LIMITED and you must bring your own tent or share with friend or partner! Bring Mosquito and Tick repellent, your own sleeping bag, flash / head light, chair, food, drinks / cooler and anything you may want to share.

-Please do not reserve unless you are 100% sure you can make it.

- If you were bringing a friend or partner, make sure he or she join HVH. Non members can not be admitted to this event because of the liability waver.

- Try to carpool if you can so that we can save on parking space.

Program:

Meet @ 9:30am 

(Make sure you bring snacks, lunch and water etc...)

We will need to drop off our Kayaks in Pond Eddy  and drive for 15 minutes to Matamoras most of the cars and drive back  with a couple of cars (We will make the members who are renting to drive us back) for another 15 minutes to Pond Eddy to start our Adventure for 4 hours Yak. 

Please make sure you are on time: 9:30am


(It will be nice kayaking for about 13 miles slow pace and there will be 4 rapids to face on the way all different levels 1 to 3)

(There is also  a local supper & Liquor market store on the way to my place to pick anything you may may need for the night etc...)

Around 5 pm back to my place for camp, Bonfire & Potluck

Next day in the morning:

Breakfast then take off for your next HVH adventure! (or if you would like you can join us for Tubing Sunday)


Thank you and looking forward to have fun with you all.

results.description:
PADDLES UP!!  Intro to Dragon Boat Paddling.

Every Saturday we welcome new members to try out this new sport of Dragon Boating. No experience needed; coaching, training and all equipment supplied.

If this is your first time trying this sport out, the cost is free.  If you already attended our " Free intro to Dragon Boating" on May 2nd and May 9th, the cost is $10 per session.  However, the fee is applied to the season membership fee of $75 (mid season rate now) if you become a member of "Team Dragon".  Full time College or High School Student Fee is only $35.  Membership comes with unlimited Dragon Boat practices/training every Thursday 6-8pm, every Saturday 10-12am and all events hosted by the NJ Dragon Boat Club at Lake Parsippany.  The season runs from April to September.

To become a season member, go to njdragonboat.org and complete the online registration.

Come out and give it a try and get a great work out!

Expect to meet new friends and enjoy the beautiful Lake!  Please wear appropriate clothing (no jeans), footwear, and sunblock as you may get a little wet from paddling. Bring a bottle of water to rehydrate. 

Please park on the side streets and not in the boat house parking lot.

Please complete and bring this WAIVER (linked) for each individual.

In the event of inclement weather. Please check this site at 8:30am Saturday morning to see if the event is cancelled.
results.how_to_find_us: Boat house (please do not park at the boat house, please park on the side streets)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Taken a surf lesson but not sure if you should take another or how to continue learning or how to give it a second shot on your own? This meetup group is branched off of Jack's to serve that niche and purpose! It is for all those interested in developing their knowledge, skills, and experience through a support group of surfers transitioning from a beginner to semi-intermediate level and stoked to get out there again! You can be serious or subtle in how far you would like to take yourself, no matter what it'll be a good time (I bet you have never seen a surfer having a bad one) so why not join us. Let's all hit the waves one way or another until we can get on top of them!

Costs (Estimates): To rent can be $30-$50 depending on location and time, $12 for a beach pass, rash guard $30 (to keep).

Itinerary (Tentative): As described in How to find us, to start we'll conjure by Long Beach Surf Shop to borrow boards/buy gear, maybe grab a bite of energy next door at Life's a Bagel, then head down to the shore at Lincoln (section of Long Beach where the surfers are allowed and assemble) together between 10:15-10:30AM and take it from there!

Rides: Anybody who is trying to carpool can post in the comments. I live Upper East Side and could pick up whoever might be on the way. Otherwise there is always the train route.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll conjure by Long Beach Surf Shop to borrow boards/buy gear and grab a bite of energy next door at Life's a Bagel then head out together at 10:15AM. Save my cell# 585-465-1280 in case.

results.description:
Leader: Angela Coble,[masked] (only call morning of hike if necessary)
Meet: 10 AM at Trailside Nature Center. 4+ miles on various trails at a moderately brisk pace. Boots required. Bring water. Watch this site on the morning of August 29 for any last minute changes/cancellations.
Plan to arrive by 9:45 as we leave by 10 am.

A REMINDER: If this is your third trial hike with the TSR Meetup group we now ask you to join our TriState Ramblers Club for $15 for membership through June 30, 2016.  By paying the club membership fee you will have a FULLER SCHEDULE of hikes, bike rides and canoeing events 6 DAYS a week, all year long, as your meetup trials expire after you attend three events. Our TriState Ramblers membership application can be found on line at www.tsr.nynjtc.org 

DIRECTIONS:

WATCHUNG RESERVATION, Mountainside ,NJ See http://www.ucnj.org/trailside/

Trailside Nature Center, Coordinates: N40° 40.97', W74° 22.38'

1.1.  FROM LIVINGSTON: Take John F. Kennedy Parkway past the Short Hills Mall keep left, following signs

to SUMMIT and River Rd. Proceed 0.5 miles at light by Novartis, turn left onto Morris Ave. Continue 1.9 miles past Overlook Hospital as road bends to left. After passing the hospital, take the first right onto Glenside Ave. then in 0.1 miles bear left onto Baltusrol Rd (signs says US 22) road name changes to Summit Rd. After 1.1 miles, at light, turn right onto Summit Lane. At traffic circle, take the second right and proceed 0.5 miles further to a right turn onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.

1.2.  ALTERNATIVE: VIA US ROUTE 22: Take Mountainside/New Providence Rd. exit (turn right from westbound lanes; jug-handle from eastbound lanes). Proceed uphill northwest bound for 0.7 miles (name changes to Deer Path) to the 5th right onto Ackerman Ave. In 0.4 miles at Tee intersection, turn right onto Coles Ave. Proceed 0.2 miles to Trailside Nature & Science Center parking lot on the left.

1.3.  ALTERNATIVE: VIA I-78 EAST: Take Exit 44 (New Providence/Berkeley Heights). At light turn left onto Glenside Ave. Go 1.3 miles and turn right into the Watchung Reservation (CR 645 - W.R. Tracey Dr). Proceed past Lake Surprise, uphill and straight past loop picnic area. Bear left and continue 1.3 miles to traffic circle. At traffic circle take the first right and proceed 0.5 mile on Summit Lane. Turn right onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet Angela at Trailside Nature Center Parking Lot.
results.name: HIKE - Watchung Reservation, Mountainside, NJ

This session will begin at 10am sharp and and late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game. We will play two 40 minute games with 10 minutes for half time.

The game format is two 7v7 games, running simultaneously. Winners and losers of the first game will play against each other in the second game.

Fun Play 
No Sliding 
Goals after half point only. 
Kick-ins.. no throw ins. 
Corner kicks. 
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect PS2G plays clean soccer! This means no cursing, insulting, complaining, arguing or fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style or if you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

AGAIN - NO CLEATS ALLOWED!

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free.

http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

About Us

“Waku Waku” is a new Japanese pop culture festival launching this summer in New York City. Waku Waku +NYC brings together the worlds of anime, manga, music, food, film, and fashion inside Brooklyn’s Greenpoint and Williamsburg neighborhoods. Featuring exhibits, panels, screenings, and interactive events across multiple locations, Waku Waku +NYC looks to blend Japanese pop culture with Brooklyn culture. We look to gather a group of creative artists from Japan in order to share their passions with us. It's Cool Japan meets New York's Coolest Borough. With a focus on access and engagement, Waku Waku +NYC is built to inspire new audiences, new ideas, and feel “Waku Waku!” (わくわく) = Japanese “excitement in a dream-like state.” We want your dreams, ideas, and passions to come into fruition all in one event!

Waku Waku +NYC is owned and operated by Azix, Inc. (www.azix.net)

results.description:
We do our summer runs in the morning, because it works better for the school, and it's also cooler in the AMs. Plus, you get to start your day off right! :)

Welcome!


If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

What is Waku Waku? A Japanese expression for excitement and the name of a new Japanese pop culture festival launching in Brooklyn on August 29-30, 2015. A celebration of anime, manga, music, food, film, fashion, and more, Waku Waku +NYC features guests from Japan, interactive exhibits, workshops, exclusives, and premieres. Waku Waku +NYC encourages creativity and wants all our attendees to feel "waku waku"!

Where is Waku Waku? Waku Waku +NYC's HQ is in the brand new Brooklyn Expo Center with special events spread over Brooklyn's Greenpoint and Williamsburg neighborhoods. Just a short hop from Manhattan by subway or water taxi, Waku Waku +NYC combines Cool Japan with New York's coolest borough.

Be Waku Waku! Tickets to Waku Waku +NYC give you access to exhibits, panels, screenings, and signings in the Brooklyn Expo Center and across Brooklyn. For more details, visit wakuwaku.nyc!

Be a VIP! Waku Waku +NYC offers a limited number of VIP tickets - including a separate entrance to the Brooklyn Expo Center, a fast pass you can use to guarantee spots in up to six panels and signings, an official Waku Waku poster and T-Shirt, and more to be revealed!

Small sided games

results.description:
Curious about web development? Read about it online, or done some introductory courses on Codecademy? Want to learn more, face-to-face with others in a welcoming community?

Join us to dive into “full stack web development” and learn about the full stack from the front end to the back end. In this full-day workshop, we’ll collectively work through each of the three introductory topics from our Beginner series: 

</a>

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/DBC-NYC/events/224449450/">HTML/CSS for Beginners - evening workshop [8/18 from 7-9pm]
Javascript for Beginners - evening workshop [8/20 from 6:30-9:30pm]
Ruby for Beginners - evening workshop [8/24 from 6:30-9:30pm]


</a>

All of these elements combine to make the World Wide Web go ‘round! Specifically, we’ll cover:

* All the tools you need to get up, running and coding with HTML, CSS, Ruby and JavaScript

* Building and styling a basic webpage with HTML and CSS

* Basic programming concepts like variables, loops, functions, strings, arrays and objects

* How to write these things in JavaScript and Ruby
Interacting with the HTML and CSS of a webpage using JavaScript

* Setting up a simple web server using Ruby and sending HTML pages to a browser

* The basics of interacting with a third party API (the Twitter API in this workshop)

• Available resources if you’d like to continue learning 

Prerequisite: A basic understanding of HTML/CSS, JavaScript and Ruby (e.g. topics covered in Codecademy’s <a href="https://www.codecademy.com/tracks/web">HTML/CSS, JavaScript and Ruby<a href="https://www.codecademy.com/tracks/javascript"></a> tracks).


This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in the immersive program. Please bring your own laptop (Mac-preferred). Lunch will be provided.
results.name: Full Stack Web Development: What you can build in a day

About our Meetup:

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com

Thrive in the Park was created by a group of friends with a common interest in fitness, clean food, and having a great time.

Our goal is to get in the best shape while in the company of great people.

The work out will consist of body weight exercises (pushup, sit ups, squats, lunges, jumps, team competitions, partner exercises, etc).

results.description:
Let's have another volunteer meetup outing and join the army of volunteers at St. Joseph's soup kitchen!

The Out and About Cooking Team will be supervised by the soup kitchen's head chef as we join other volunteers and chop, dice, slice, stir, and prepare hearty meals for over 400 clients.  The clients range from fixed-income local residents and the elderly, to street people who are truly suffering.


We will meet at 10am and work until about 12:30pm, after which we will hand off the meals to the Out and About Serving Team that will host and serve the clients of the soup kitchen starting at 12:30pm.

All members are free to volunteer for both teams/shifts if desired!

When you sign up, you will be put on a waitlist.   In order to secure a spot, Out and About is asking for a donation of $10 that will be forwarded to St. Joseph's as a contribution and on behalf of the Out & About group - what a great way to volunteer and make a donation at the same time!

In order to have 100% of fees go to the soup kitchen (and avoid transaction fees), we are using the new Method of Payment through Chase QuickPay - when you register, you will be asked as part of the questions process, to confirm your full name and email so we can initiate the payment/donation process.  The QuickPay method is preferred, but if paypal is your preferred route, then my email address is [masked]

Upon receiving your $10 donation, you will be taken off the wait list and identified as attending.  

I ask that if you sign up that you fulfill your role as a volunteer and show up on that day, i.e. do not cancel.  If circumstances require that you cancel, please tell me so that I can find a substitute.  No shows are highly discouraged and can jeopardize our volunteer efforts.

Thank you in advance.  


.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>
results.name: Tennis Social

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2015

"I have tried many different forms of meditation and yoga over the years. Though I have experienced some positive changes practicing over the years I never felt committed to practice on regular basis. Nan takes it to a whole other level. How and why? All I can say is you have to experience it for yourself. There is power in simplicity,love, and truth. Despite some language barriers(which are minor) You can feel her love and healing energy. Open your mind and see with a different set of eyes. I highly recommend her special Saturday classes." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class Saturday November 15, 2014

“ My first time today. Nan is very helpful and dedicated. I enjoyed it immensely and I did experience a shift in energy. I feel more alert, relaxed and focused even as I write this testimony. I plan on attending her next class in Freeport." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class September 17, 2014

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

"I have been attending these classes for three weeks. They are amazing. Nan is wonderful! My energy level is shifting and I am beginning to experience an ongoing sense of well-being with balance and relaxation. Highly recommend!" Kathleen, Bodhi Meditation class October 25, 2013

------------------------------------------------------------------

Between May 14,2013 and October 2014 over 2,500 people attended our classes in NYC and Long Island.

The Saturday class is for a small group. Up to 8 people.

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness

* Stronger emotional intelligence

* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strengthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated

* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America.

Feel free to ask Nan your personal health questions after the class.

Please arrive early for class intro/setup.

Class basic info:

* Loose fitting clothes is recommended but not required.

* Some people bring their own yoga mat for the seated meditation part. This is not a requirement as we have chairs for everyone.

* Cellphones needed to be turned off during the class.

Here is the internet link if you are interested in purchasing the meditation music used in the class.

http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1

</a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> ----------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
Every time we have a fencing meetup in the park, we meet new people.  Some of them are meetup members who couldn't make meetups at other times, others are just people in the park.  But they're all fun.

Cancellations are much more likely in the summer!  A meetup can be canceled because the ground is too wet, rain is predicted, high heat & humidity are predicted, or just because there aren't enough people committed to being there.  PLEASE RSVP, and come if you say you will. I will post cancellations here by 9am on the day.


To find us, enter the park via the entrance opposite the Ethical Culture School (The Ethical Culture School is on the west side of Central Park West) at 63rd and Central Park West.  The "Backup Fencing Spot" is on your right, just inside the entrance to the park.  Soccer kids have been grabbing our "Where We Fence" location pretty steadily, but to find it, follow the paved path in a large arc to your left, (It starts off heading SE and curves around to NW).  The "Where We Fence" location is on the hard packed dirt under the trees. 


We have a very limited amount of equipment to lend. We're willing to share, but if you have your own equipment, please bring it.

It's also a good idea to bring water!

A more detailed map of where we fence in Central Park is here:

https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=212152258049056562883.0004db7dc1516e1da7244&msa=0&ie=UTF8&t=m&z=17&vpsrc=0

venue.name: Carl Schurz Park

results.description:
This will be a moderate-paced 12-mile hike along the East River, with great views of the river, bridges, islands and various landmarks.  We will walk up the East River Greenway, across the Ward's Island Bridge, across the Triboro Bridge to Astoria, along the East River parks and then across the Queensboro Bridge back to Manhattan. 

The walk will take about 6 hours; there are numerous drop off points once we reach Astoria, which will be about 7 miles and three hours into the walk.  We will start at Carl Schurz Park then walk Ward's Island, Astoria Park, Socrates Sculpture Park, Rainey Park and Queensbridge Park.  

We will mostly be walking on flat, paved paths and sidewalks, but each of the three bridges has steep walkways, the Triboro Bridge has multiple stairways, the walkway across the Triboro Bridge is high and narrow so you may not want to try it if you are wary of heights. 

Bring food and drink. We will stop at a deli after crossing the Triboro and eat lunch in Astoria Park.

Meet: We will meet inside Carl Schurz Park, by the restrooms at the East 87th Street and East End Avenue entrance. Take the 4,5,6 train to 86th Street.


Leader: Tom Bergen [masked][masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Triboro to Queensboro

venue.address_1: a short distance east of the entrance to the park at 110th St. and Lenox Ave.
venue.name: Benches outside the Dana Discovery Center

results.description: Meet 10:30 at the Dana Discovery Center (restrooms), where there is a current exhibit of the lakes and waterways of the park. You get there by taking the No. 2 or 3 subway to 110th St., exiting at the south end of the station, or by taking a northbound 2, 3, or 4 Madison Avenue bus to 110th St. After entering the park, walk directly east along the Harlem Meer for a short distance to the Discovery Center. From there we'll go up to the Blockhouse, which was built during the War of 1812, and is the oldest structure standing in the park, and through the North Woods (a forested area which few visitors to the park ever see). Then up the Great Hill and down through the Loch and the Ravine; and finally lunch in the Conservatory Garden (bring lunch and beverage). Around a mile altogether at a very leisurely pace, with many stops. Call or email to make sure that the walk will take place (it may be cancelled because of bad weather or for other reasons) and if you have any questions. Bob Susser,[masked]; [masked].
results.name: Highlights of Northern Central Park

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
Update: Weather forecast looks good, sunny, few clouds, 86 max. Bring some sunscreen. I'll be waiting at a bench along the waterfront in front of the eagle statue. I'll be wearing a meetup-red tank top. CU tomorrow. Verena

My dear fellow photographers.

Let's meet and focus on some details again. This challenge is about creating a series of pictures that have ONE thing in common: an object within the same color (tone). I will let you choose ONE color for that day. Don't cheat. Stick to the color, see things you normally would ignore or oversee. It's easier to focus on ONE thing. I'm sure the result will be a great series of pictures.

We will meet at the boardwalk in front of the East Coast Memorial in Battery Park. That's the big open plaza with the gigantic eagle statue. From there, we will make our way to Governor's Island. The ferry leaves @ 11:30 sharp, that will be the last FREE ferry for the day. So please be on time. Governor's Island ferry terminal is located just next to the Staten Island Ferry Terminal, the green kinda old looking building.

We will wonder through the beautiful island as individuals or smaller groups,  check out the temporary art/ architecture pavilions, the old fortress and may have a nap in the hammocks ;)  

Bathrooms availability is a little limited on the island, but you'll find some potties here and there. For those who want to stick around, we can meet later again and grab some food together. There are choices on the island or in Manhattan or Brooklyn. Let's play it by ear.

This is a link to a downloadable map of the island:

http://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/gov-island-site/pages/GI_visitor_map_district_marker_MA.PDF

http://govisland.com/

And here is what you should bring:

* Camera -- along with charged battery and empty memory card.  

* Any lens will work for this, but I recommend a zoom lens, macro or something with a longer focal length, like 50mm, 100, 200. This will allow you to get smaller objects of your color choice in a nice frame.

* Bring snacks & water to stay hydrated.

* Shades, hat, and sunscreen may not be a bad idea.

* Be on time! This event starts at 10:30 am sharp!! So give yourself plenty of time to travel. Check for service changes or delays. I will not wait for latecomers and I will not answer calls, emails and/or messages after 10 am.

* Dress appropriately for the weather and definitely wear comfortable shoes. 

Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are. 


~ Verena [masked]-RENA (7362) 

******************** 

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
results.name: Detail Series - ONE color on Governor's Island

results.description:
This will be a guided tour (with much commentary) following the shoreline of the Hudson River in Lower Manhattan (from Battery Park to the end of the High Line).   We will visit the many scenic parks, public artwork and Memorials that dot this section of New York City.

We will be walking at a moderate (not slow pace).  There will be no lunch stop, but there will be restroom stops.  The walk will last about three hours and will cover 3 1/2 miles. 

When we reach the Southern entrance to the High Line, you will have the choice of visiting the new Whitney Museum or continuing to the end of the High Line.  The walk will end at 34th Street and Tenth Avenue, where you can either walk or take a bus to the Subway

Heavy rain or excessive heat will cancel the walk, check this site for updates.

LEADER: Bob Lazzaro, email: [masked]

This event is free for Shorewalker members who have paid their annual dues, all those attending who have joined via the Shorewalker MeetUp site (but have not paid their annual dues) this event will cost $3.00.  To join Shorewalkers and to check out the various Membership levels visit the www.shorewalkers.org website.

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and a dozen of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending.  If you want to know the exact number of people coming or have any other questions contact [masked].

Governors Island is one of the most interesting places to visit in NYC.  It was once home to Native American tribes, then Dutch and British settlements, a strategic part of the American Revolution and the home for the U.S. Coast Guard for many years.  Now the island is a historic goldmine that offers spectacular views of Manhattan and much more.  Join a group of NYSN members and friends as we travel to the island together, head to the famous island food square then enjoy special guided tour of the historic area of the island given by a Nation Parks Ranger.  You will have a chance to discover the historic Fort Jay and other amazing sites. 

The group will travel over together on the 11:am ferry.  From there you will explore parts of the island that include fascinating old houses that were once lived in by Generals and Majors, a trip to Hammock Grove and then lunch at the picnic area with top rated gourmet food trucks. Following the lunch you will enjoy a guided tour through history given by a Governors Island expert!  Following the tour you can return to NYC with the group, stay on the island to explore on your own, rent a bike, see the art exhibits.

How do I get there? Meet the group at the Battery Maritime Building at 10 South Street on the corner of South and Whitehall Streets in Lower Manhattan and next door to the Staten Island ferry terminal at 10:30am sharp.  Here is a link for the building:  Battery Maritime Building

How will find the group?  The leader will have an NYSN/Meet up Sign and will be standing just outside or inside of the ferry terminal entrance glass doors..  When you register you will also be sent an email the morning of with the cell phone contact of the person hosting the group. 

What should I wear? Summer clothes, comfortable shoes, sunblock

What should I bring? bottled water/camera. Bring your own lunch or buy from a food truck

What if it rains? We will make a decision to go ahead or cancel the tour based on the forecast.  Refunds will be given only if the tour does not happen.

Can I invite a friend?  Most will come on their own but if you wish to invite a guest, please choose as many tickets as you would like.

What is included:  The tour, park donation, ferry, guide fee

How can I pay? Please bring exact change ($15) as that help speed up the check in process.

What to expect: 30-40 fun and friendly people ages 20's - 40's 

Why should I go on this tour? Because you have never been to Governors Island or have been there and do not know the history.  Because you want to enjoy a nice day out of the city at an amazing place with beautiful views or  because you have nothing better to do this afternoon!
results.name: Governors Island History Tour:  Explore, Socialize & Eat!

results.description:
Studio Series #5

Life in Balance Meditation

In our day to day, we're bombarded with the message that life is about being "happy." Nearly everywhere we look, we experience the pressure to outwardly display to the world how full of sunshine and smiles our lives are. Even many the most well-meaning Self Help Gurus preach a life full of happiness. The problem is that this is very often in discordance with life itself. This pressure can leave us feeling like something is terribly wrong with us when we're not as blissfully giddy as everyone's news feed reflects.

Very often, the feeling of "distress" we dread isn't created by our negative emotions, but rather it's manifested from the internal struggle and fight we experience when trying to avoid or push these feelings away. This can present itself in ways such as getting angry at oneself for feeling down, over-doing happy hour to avoid being still with one's thoughts, or even by hiding these experiences from those around us. By allowing these negative thoughts and emotions in a safe and non-judgmental way, we can begin to bring some more compassion to our experiences and be more in harmony with our bodies and our lives. 

Through Enodia Center's unique Life in Balance Meditation, we'll practice validating both Positive and Negative Emotions, and seeing them for what they are: normal, vital aspects of Our Human Experience.

At this Meetup, we'll connect and talk about the topic via informal group discussion, then experience a full guided Life in Balance Meditation, followed by Q&A, connecting with other like-minded women, warm tea, and light refreshments (aka chocolate.)

What to expect:

All of Enodia Center’s sessions, Studio Series, and community events are designed to be realistic for every woman. You don’t have to alter your beliefs, lifestyle, or wardrobe to experience all the benefits of our Studio Series. Therefore, this is a totally "come as you are" Meetup. The only request we have is that you remove your shoes, so comfy socks are always a plus!  

As always, don't hesitate to contact me at [masked] with any questions. Looking forward to connecting with you!



**Please note, all payments must be received at least 2 days prior to the event, otherwise your space will be released to another Meetup member. Don't hesitate to contact me with any questions about this. Thank you for your cooperation, and we look forward to seeing you there!**
results.how_to_find_us: Located on the Second Floor, Studio 1 - Between The Originals Salon and Victor's Suits
results.name: Allowing Our Negative Emotions and Freeing Ourselves from Distress

group.name: Women's Relaxation and Mindful Stress Management Meetup

results.description:
Who is this event for?

The goal of UX Hackathon is to teach you effective strategies for creating powerful online experiences. If you are new to UX, consider this your crash course. This event is a great opportunity to see first hand what methods UX designers use to increase purchasing and sign up new users. We’ll dive into common tools like Sketch App and Invision for prototyping. Learn to build a clickable wireframe that’ll turn guests into consumers. For more advanced designers, get to know the science behind the best websites and apps. Prizes and recognition await the team that builds the best clickable wireframe.

Sponsored by StackExchange and Invision App. 

Lunch, snacks and refreshments provided.


Meetup members Save 10% on Deluxe Passes: If you would like to attend both the Hackathon and the After Party, there are discounted tickets on Eventbrite.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hackathon-ux-the-science-behind-conversion-tickets-18156010115?discount=nycuxspecial

Part I: Hackathon

To kick off the day, Laurence Adrian, senior UX designer at Dom & Tom will lead a presentation on what biological and psychological factors influence our decisions and what strategies UX designers can use to create high conversion websites. After the presentation, we'll review methods for rapid prototyping using Sketch & Invision App.

Now you're ready to build your own clickable wireframe for onboarding and purchasing!

At 12:00 O'clock, we’ll break for lunch. There will be FREE pizza, snacks, and refreshments! Attendees will then have the opportunity to form teams. Each team will be given a use case to develop a high conversion onboarding experience using Sketch and Invision App. At this time feel free to ask questions and get help building your clickable wireframe (prototype).

At 4:00 O'clock, each team will have five minutes to present their prototype to a panel of judges.

At 5:15, the winning team will be announced and crowned victorious.

Prizes for Hackathon

• One-year free Invision Starter Plan for winning team

• 3-month Invision trial plan for ALL attendees

• Raffling three (3) full licenses of Sketch App

Rules

By attending the event, you agree to the rules and terms set forth.


Part II: Hackathon After Party [separate tickets required]

At 6:30pm, after the hackathon, we’ll segue into the mixer event. Have your fill of FREE beer, wine, and hors d'oeuvres. This is a great opportunity to socialize and network with industry professionals.
results.how_to_find_us: 28th Floor
results.name: UX Hackathon: The Science Behind Conversion

group.name: MANHATTAN SOCCER - COED SOCCER IN NYC

results.description:
10-a-side. 2 teams, 60min+ game. Pls arrive early, to warm up and be ready to start at 10.45am.



ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.

If we have extra players we'll sub, or play 10v10. It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.


• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.


•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.


• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.


• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


The payment goes toward field permit & equipment. 

See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Saturday Soccer 10v10 @10:45am Pier 5- Full-size goals, 75min+

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Do something GREAT this Summer!!


Take Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park
Free Group Lessons Saturdays, May 16th to October 17.


You will learn to read notes, chords and play songs you know and love.  You will have the opportunity to learn:


• Basic info about the guitar
• To read and play chords
• To read and play Rhythm
• Techniques for using the pick
• How play finger style.
• What you learn can be applied to Rock, Blues, Folk, Country,
   Jazz, Classical
• Plenty of new songs


Anyone can attend and you don't need to attend all the sessions.  A new breakthrough approach, allows each session to be complete even for people who have no experience playing the guitar.  Note: You must RSVP by 9pm on Friday the day before the meetup is scheduled. After 9p.m., registration will be closed.

And after the lesson (12:30 - 1:30p.m), hang out and network with  people, or go check out the sights in the Park!!

WHAT TO BRING:

• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Bring a portable music stand if you have one
• Also bring a 3-ring binder and a pencil


OPTIONAL DONATION: The lesson is FREE.  However, your voluntary $5 or  $10 donation help to offset the cost of making the free lessons available to you.



IN CASE OF RAIN:
If it rains, or there's a threat of rain (including if there is rain the night before or in the early morning and the ground is left soggy), we will have the meetup at an indoor location; check the meetup group announcements for update if looks like rain...the alternate location we will meet at is:

The Sony Public Atrium (pictured below)
550 Madison Avenue, NY, NY  10022
Enter on 55th Street, and look for the guitars gathered near the Starbucks to the right of the entrance.

Remember: please update your RSVP if your plans change and you are unable to make it.  If something changes the day of the meetup, please let me know by phone or text at[masked]-1031.
results.name: Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park - Free!!

results.description:
Tickets: https://goo.gl/EtJPS8

Join us as we explore what was once the playgrounds of all things gang and mob related on this 2.5 hour walking tour. Stroll through historic downtown neighborhoods as you peer into their dark past. Visit famous sites of killings, movies, and infamous crimes.

Peer into New York's dark past and uncover hidden secrets when you visit places ruled by some of the city's most powerful gangs and mobs. Head to Little Italy, once the heart of a tight community of Italian immigrants, to hear stories about mob activities and visit notorious spots. You’ll also explore the little-known history of the Chinese migration to New York, and the dominance of dangerous street gangs and underground opium dens, as well as the ruthless gangs in the infamous Five Points area, and what became of them. Along the way you’ll stop to see historic sites, sample the local fare and discover hidden stories waiting to be revealed.

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/kV4c3ERMQE2CNwdoxBC9

Tickets: https://goo.gl/EtJPS8

results.name: Learn New York's History

results.description:
Wall Street Historic Tour is unusual walking path that brings you to some of the most important historical points in the history of America as lived in New York City. You will see the early settlement excavation which began in 1624 under the city’s original name- New Amsterdam. You will learn about the lifestyle and rules of the Dutch settlers. You will see Liberty Hall and visit George Washington’s personal pew in church, his favorite tavern, and visit Wall Street where across from the stock exchange, he was sworn in as the first president of the United States. Nearby, visit he first park in New York City and see the shrine of Ann Ellizabeth Seton,the first American Born Catholic canonized by a Romanian Pope. This tour includes such sightseeing as:

City Hall

Brooklyn Bridge

St. Paul Chapel

Trinity Church

Federal Hall and Charging Bull

Bowling Green Park

Elizabeth Seton Shrine

Frances Tavern

and more

Ticket is $10, buy here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wall-street-historic-tour-tickets-18325451920
results.how_to_find_us: In front of TD Bank 258 Broadway New York, NY, New York, NY

results.description:
Greenwich Village in Manhattan is a community with a global history and reputation. The quiet streets of the area have been the stage for creative and social movements that today give shape to the unique American character. The area started out as farm territory and later became an immigrant community. In the first half of the 20th century the area was inhabited by some of the greatest creative minds of American Culture. Today the area retains its cultural essence in diverse aspects and the public art and architecture contrast richly with the greater metropolitan environment of NYC.

Itinerary:
• Father Demo Square
• Bleecker Street
• Cherry Lane Theater
• Sheridan Square
• Cafe Wha?
• Washington Square Park
• New York University
• And Much More

Reservations: 
Please RSVP.If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins at father Demo Square on 6th Av. and Bleecker St. map here. Tour concludes at Washington Square Park map here.

Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:
results.how_to_find_us: Father Demo Square has a fountain in the middle. I will be standing by that fountain.
results.name: The Art and Culture of Greenwich Village

Sign Up Here! https://goo.gl/gM5KeB

Join us as we explore what was once the playgrounds of all things gang and mob related on this 2.5 hour walking tour. Stroll through historic downtown neighborhoods as you peer into their dark past. Visit famous sites of killings, movies, and infamous crimes.

Peer into New York's dark past and uncover hidden secrets when you visit places ruled by some of the city's most powerful gangs and mobs. Head to Little Italy, once the heart of a tight community of Italian immigrants, to hear stories about mob activities and visit notorious spots. You’ll also explore the little-known history of the Chinese migration to New York, and the dominance of dangerous street gangs and underground opium dens, as well as the ruthless gangs in the infamous Five Points area, and what became of them. Along the way you’ll stop to see historic sites, sample the local fare and discover hidden stories waiting to be revealed.
results.name: NYC History of Mobsters

results.description:
Stuyvesant Square is one of my favorite parks in the city, because it's quiet and perhaps because it's across the street from my apartment. Late August usually has some really nice flowers out by the fountain there. There is also beautiful Quaker architecture all around to draw.

We'll meet in the center of the West side of the park, which is 16th street between 2nd & 3rd avenues. (The east side of the park is under construction.)

Any problems on the day of the event, I can be reached at [masked]. 


Looking forward to sketching with you!

What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!

• We sketch for a bit, usually 45 minutes or so, and then get back together and share our drawings, and then sketch again, etc. There's usually time for 3 or 4 sketches.

• Please bring your own supplies - anything you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• Please take care to make sure we do not leave any trash behind. Please also leave any dogs at home; they tend to knock over the artwork. Thanks. 

• This Meetup is FREE and everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

In case of rain, I will let people know early in the morning if it is canceled, and then reschedule for another day.

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to regular attendee.

Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.
results.name: Draw Stuyvesant Square!

results.description:
Festival at 11:00am and Parade at 12:00pm        

                             Western Beef Supermarket Parking Lot

                                           322 Nassau Road

                                         Roosevelt, NY 11575

                            Vendors and Talent Call[masked]

                            FAMILY, COMMUNITY AND CULTURE

The Youth Empowerment Institute, Inc. along with Economic Opportunity Commission of Nassau County, Inc. will be holding its Third Annual Long Island African American Heritage Parade and 33rd TAHAD Festival on Saturday, August 29, 2015. The parade route will start at 322 Nassau Road in Roosevelt, New York (Western Beef) parking lot and will end on Nicholas Court in Hempstead, NY where the festival will be held at.
The Third Annual Long Island African American parade and the 33rd TAHAD Festival is set to be the driving force in strengthening families, bringing unity in the community and embracing culture. We are thrilled to have Meli’sa Morgan who is a 2014 Soul Train Music Award Nominee R&B Songstress and was also featured on TV One Unsung. Meli'sa Morgan is known for her 80’s hit “Do Me Baby” and will be our main performer at the festival. The parade and festival is set to host a variety of performances that will have you dancing and singing throughout the day. There will be a variety of fine cuisines that will be serviced by our vendors. 
A Health Pavilion will be available for you to sign up for health insurance and free health screenings will be available to the community.  African Americans are at the highest risk for diabetes and high blood pressure so it’s very imperative that you get a health screening that will be provided at the festival. The Kiddy Corner will be available for children to enjoy activities in a family friendly environment.
The African American Heritage Parade and Festival objectives are to showcase the richness of the African American community on Long Island, educate our youth and allow them to experience African American pride by embracing its legacy. Our Seven Grand Marshalls will be introducing the Seven Principals of Kwanzaa with the purpose of contributing in building and reinforcing family, community and culture among African American people as well as Africans throughout the world. 
These values are called the Nguzo Saba which in Swahili means the Seven Principles. Developed by Dr. Karenga, the Nguzo Saba stands at the heart of the origin and meaning of Kwanzaa, for it is these values which are not only the building blocks for community but also serve to reinforce and enhance them.
Vending opportunities are available and performing artists are encouraged to contact us today. For information on participating in the African American Parade and Festival, feel free to contact us via email at [masked] or call <a>[masked]</a>. For media inquiries regarding the parade and festival, please contact Lithera Forbes at <a>[masked]</a> or via email at [masked] or contact Phil Andrews at <a>[masked]</a> or email me at [masked] . 

Phil Andrews
results.name: African-American Heritage Parade & Music Festival

results.description:
Inline skate lesson for Beginner to intermediate skaters.
We should have a great day to skate.
Cost of this class is: $25 per individual class, $45 for 2 classes or $60 for package of 3 classes; fees are collected before class begins, however we suggest that you to pay in advance, using Pay Pal option.

Please note that you must have complete set of protection gear and helmet to participate in class.

We meet in the Blades Skate Store, 156 West 72nd St., near Amsterdam Ave. at 11:30AM, if you need to rent skates and all of your gear. The class leaves for the lesson area by 11:45AM.  We will then walk to the practice area so we are geared up ready to skate by 12:00PM. As a reminder – helmets, wrist, knee and elbow guards are required. These can be rented at Blades if needed. Please have your gear by 1:15PM, so we can get started. If possible, rent the gear the day before the class as it is a 24 hour rental. Please check all of your gear before coming to class to see if it fits properly. Make sure the wheels, buckles, straps, snaps, laces and everything else is in good working order.

Please note that if it is raining or the lesson surface is wet, we will NOT have the class.
If you have any other questions, please post them on this page or text/call me at [masked]
