• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T. )

(Co-Leader- Jefferson)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
This month we'll discuss "A Princess of Mars" by Edgar Rice Burroughs.  It is a science fantasy novel, the first of his Barsoom series. The story is set on Mars<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars"></a>, imagined as a dying planet with a harsh desert environment.  The Barsoom series inspired a number of well-known 20th century science fiction writers, including Jack Vance, Ray Bradbury, Arthur C. Clarke, Robert A. Heinlein, and John Norman. The series was also inspirational for many scientists in the fields of space exploration and the search for extraterrestrial life, including Carl Sagan, who read A Princess of Mars when he was a child.


The meeting will be hosted by Wendy at her house in White Plains. We will provide stuffed burgers. Please bring fruit salad, vegetables, potato salad, macaroni salad, appetizers, drinks or desserts. Let everyone know what you will be bringing by commenting on this meeting.

Looking forward to seeing everyone on Saturday, 8/29/2015 at 11:30a.

results.description:
Official International Cosplay Day 2015 event page

follow our ICD Page: https://www.facebook.com/IntCosDay and our founder's Page: https://www.facebook.com/ICDFounderJenniferAlice

International Cosplay Day is a day where you can get dressed in cosplay and you can go out and join an event that is happening in your area (if there is one) or you can create an event for your area, or you can simply just cosplay and go out around your neighborhood, or go to wal-mart or to the grocery store. It is to have fun and be able to cosplay for a day even when there is no convention in your area.

For International Cosplay Day, you are not limited to
anime. You can dress up as your favorite character from a movie, a comic, tv series, a video game, or really, just about anything. :)

It occurs on the last Saturday of August, annually.

If you are planning on creating an event for your area, send me your event link (set to public) and the location of the event in a message.

you may keep up with us on twitter here: https://twitter.com/Int_Cosplay_Day


Baltimore, MD
https://www.facebook.com/events/743023409101319/

Maymont, Virginia
https://www.facebook.com/events/654075761368264/

Seville, Spain
https://www.facebook.com/events/1637129183175557/ and Page: https://www.facebook.com/CosplaySevilla

Washington,DC (DC Anime Club)
https://www.facebook.com/events/739618736110214/

Singapore
http://neotokyoproject.com/icds/

Anaheim,California
https://www.facebook.com/events/1495479374038009/

Sydney, Australia
https://www.facebook.com/events/709086395879883/

***IMPORTANT NOTICE!!!**

please make sure that when you go to your events (especially if they're in a public place) you DO NOT bring weapons. I would say, don't even bring fake weapons into a public place. I know many of your cosplays probably have weapons, but after these shootings that have happened in the U.S. in the last couple of months, I think it would be best if you didn't use any weapons with your cosplay. Fake or otherwise. I want you to all have fun, and not get into trouble or kicked out of a place because of your weapons. So please, just keep that in the back of your mind.

International Cosplay Day is Sponsored by DC Anime Club. Be sure to follow our sponsor at the followings links:

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
We are hosting the first ever Global Quack & Hack – an open source event to improve DuckDuckGo's results for developer-related searches. Our open source platform DuckDuckHack enables any developer (novices and experts alike) to create Instant Answers that help you find what you're looking for in few or zero clicks. For example, searching for regex cheat sheet or python code editor, we can show you exactly what you're looking for--above any ads or links--all thanks to DuckDuckHack contributors.

The Global Quack & Hack will include 24 hours of live chat support from our staff as well as broadcasts throughout the day to help you code up your favorite ideas. We hope that new and experienced DuckDuckHack developers will join us to improve the technical searches they do most. By bringing our community together on this day, we hope to markedly improve the search experience for all developers using DuckDuckGo.

This is a great opportunity to meet other fellow DDG contributors in the NYC area, to start contributing to the project and learn new things along the way (and maybe get some free DDG swag!)


You can find more info on the official DuckDuckGo blog

results.description:
Let's have another volunteer meetup outing and join the army of volunteers at St. Joseph's soup kitchen!

The Out and About Serving Team will be supervised by the soup kitchen's volunteer coordinator as we join other volunteers and host, scoop, and serve meals to over 400 clients.  The clients range from fixed-income local residents and the elderly, to street people who are truly suffering. 

We will meet at 12:30am and volunteer until about 3:30pm.  We will see what scrumptious meals the Out and About Cooking Team created earlier in the morning and serve with pride their creations!

All members are free to volunteer for both teams/shifts if desired!

When you sign up, you will be put on a waitlist.  In order to secure a spot, Out and About is asking for a donation of $10 that will be forwarded to St. Joseph's as a contribution and on behalf of the Out & About group - what a great way to volunteer and make a donation at the same time!  

In order to have 100% of fees go to the soup kitchen (and avoid transaction fees), we are using the new Method of Payment through Chase QuickPay - when you register, as part of the questions part of the process, you will be asked to confirm your full name and email so we can initiate the payment process.  The QuickPay method is preferred, but if paypal or pop pay is your preferred route, then my email address is [masked]

If you would like to send by post, please send me a message. I will consolidate and offer to the soup kitchen as one check on behalf of Out & About. 

Upon receiving your $10 donation, you will be taken off the wait list and identified as attending.  

I ask that if you sign up that you fulfill your role as a volunteer and show up on that day, i.e. do not cancel.  If circumstances require that you cancel, please tell me so that I can find a substitute.  No shows are highly discouraged and can jeopardize our volunteer efforts. 

Thank you in advance.  


.
results.how_to_find_us: Let's meet at the top of the stairs to the basement of the church at 6th Ave and Washington St.
results.name: 1 Soup Kitchen, 2 Shifts, 400 Clients - The Serving Team

results.description:
Summer is almost over (sad face) but a new season is almost here (yay!) You might be going back to school or just shifting into a new mindset. Maybe you're dreaming of vacations you want to take or are focused on losing a few pounds. Either way there are things we want to do. Let's make it happen and check in with all those goals we set in January.

Let's make our dream and vision boards, scrapbook or notebook of the things that we plan to make happen for the rest of the best year ever!

You know how they say visualize what you really want and make it happen? Let's finish 2015 the best ever!

Bring:

Old magazines and such to cut up(if you don't have any that's ok, plenty will be provided)

Your fancy markers or glitter

A notebook/scrapbook or posterboard

Whatever you need to visualize your best year!

Encouragement for all!

No dream, goal, or vision is too small or large, too silly or out there. We will help you get there or at that the least be awesome cheerleaders for everyone!

Come early if you want to shop in Micheal's for great supplies. The store is full of great things and inspiration.

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Level 2 class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

Anyone and everyone is welcome! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of tv production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, while at the same time, Dewey is taping his weekly MNN cable talk show, "The Midnight Kiki."
results.name: Intro to Improv [LEVEL 1]

results.description:
This is it; the FINAL Brony pool party meetup of 2015! Until Next year!


It is near the end of SUMMER, so let's have one more pool party to help stay cool as this summer comes to a close!

Note: This is a "Pot Luck" party, so at the bottom of this page there is a list of suggested food ideas that attendees can bring. If you are bringing something off the list, let me know in the comments. You are welcome to be creative! The refreshments list will be updated regularly as you comment with what you're bringing -  thanks! 

REGARDING ALCOHOL: Drinking alcohol is not allowed, this is a non-alcoholic party, however a little bit is OK, if it is strictly being used for cooking/BBQ sauce mixing.


So it is summer and it is hot. Perhaps we all can get away from the big city for a little bit and chill out in my big private pool! We will have a barbecue and I just request that everyone helps contribute food! ($5 to 7 dollars per person, spending money on food goes a LONG WAY, I got the drinks covered!) Note: At the bottom of this page there is a list of food ideas that people can bring. If you are bringing something from that list, let me know in the comments. I will update the list as it gets closer to the date!

I have a very large 16 by 33 foot pool, complete with a deck that surrounds it, along with an underwater window. (See picture below!) Everyone just needs to bring their swimming trunks or swim suits. If you do not have any, then shorts are fine. Also don't forget to bring a TOWEL!

Rules of the pool...

1. No running on the deck.

2. NO SHARP OBJECTS! (That means take off your earrings and necklaces.)

3. No Horse play (No pun intended) (Do not push or shove people off the deck.)

4. Must bring your own swim suit and towel. I said this before, but I do NOT have any spare shorts or towels to hand out.

5. No hard plastic toys. (Water guns are fine, but anything else, no.)

6.  No Jumping onto the tubes from the deck.

Later we may have a glow stick pool fetching game at night!  MY pool is equipped with an underwater light!

Moving on...

The pool not your thing? Want to just relax and enjoy the show? We have a lovely, gazee-bow, with an installed ceiling fan and lights! Chill out, under the shade and enjoy the show! We have more seating than what the picture shows. We also have 2 swing sets that fit 3 people each! Along with another outdoor picnic bench, with even more shade!

I will be BBQ-ing, so if you have something you want cooked, then feel free to bring it!

Need a list of Volunteers to take turns working the grill!

In the late evening we can chill in the projector tent or my room and play some video games, watch a few movies, or just plain fool around, once everyone had their fair share of the pool.

I welcome anyone to bring extra, consoles, controllers, laptops and more if they are looking to share!

RULES for the Projector and TV!

1. No inappropriate themes. PG-13 is OK, but no adult things, like nudity. 2. My computer has a guest account enabled with limited access. So no installing applications that I did not authorize. (You would need me to log in, in order to install stuff.) Same thing goes with the ps3 and other consoles.

3. Take turns, If one group of people want to play a group game or show a group thing, share it and take turns. Do not use the projector or TV for more then 2 hours, unless the group agrees to continue the same activity. There is the projector and the TV in my room.

DIRECTIONS!

My house is in NJ, but it is super easy to get to from NYC. Just go to NYC penn station on 34st and 7th ave. From there, take "NJ transit" to "Elizabeth". (It will cost you $13.50 round trip.) my house is only 1.3 miles from the train station. Note: Get off at "Elizabeth" NOT "north Elizabeth.".

Train times

(WILL BE UPDATED AS WE GET CLOSER TO THE DATE)

Important info about the trains

The party ends at 10:00pm. At this time, I will be offering rides back to the train station. The last train that leaves Elizabeth and goes back to NYC penn station leaves at 1:59 am. So please plan ahead. Unless you want to wait til 6 am to leave, however!!!

CARPOOLING FROM THE TRAIN STATION TO THE HOUSE, INFO...


VOLUNTEERS NEEDED FOR CARPOOLING (I am requesting anyone with a car, if they would be willing to carpool people from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM, you will be tipped $3 per person if you do. (People who are carpooling, should be tipping you.) Volunteer Driver list so far...

Rye_B (Myself) - 2003 Red Ford Escape (Limit 4 Passengers)

NOTE: Myself and other people will be car pooling people from 10:00 am to noon. After that, people will have to walk. (I just ask for 3 dollars per person, if I am carpooling you or if someone else is carpooling you. So please tip the drivers. ) You can sleep over, however I have to limit it to 10 people sleeping over, due to limited space. People who drove here get priority. For those of you who are DRIVING and have a very long ride back home, you can sleep over. My bedroom is big and I can fit many people in it. I also have a Guest bedroom. I will be checking the comments for people who say they are at the station. However I understand that not everyone one has internet on their phone. So, call or text me at "9 O eight - 5 seven eight - two 4 nine 4" (I typed my phone number in a strange way to prevent spam bots from picking it up and giving me telemarketers.)

NOTE: On the off chance that the weather is bad. Then, I will move the party inside the house. I will also update this with more details as we get closer! ALSO the FOOD and DRINK LIST IS below!

NOTE (FOOD): If you feel that you want to bring something else besides what is listed below, then by all means do so. the bottom is a suggested list. If you would like to make something special then, go for it!

The food and drink list...

Refreshment Lists are below..

Food
Hamburgers
Hot dogs
Ribs
Hot pockets/mini pizza bagels
Corn on the cob
Mac and Cheese
Pizza
Pizza rolls

Watermelons

Beverages Iced tea

Vegetarian foods

results.description:
We are excited to announce the sibsNY summer picnic in Central Park on  Saturday, August 29th 2015 (rain date: Sunday, Aug. 30th)

Please join us for a fun day and bring your sibling(s)!

What to bring:

• Something to sit on (blanket, towel, etc)  

• Something to eat and drink for you and your sib(s) - even better – bring something to share and we’ll have our own little pot luck picnic! 

(If you cannot bring food, no worries, you can buy lunch at the nearby cafe)

Directions:


We will be meeting in the Sheep Meadow section of Central Park, close to the Le Pain Quotidien Cafe and accessable bathrooms.  If coming from the west side, use the W 69th Street entrance (approx a 4 minute walk into the park). If coming from the east side, use the E 69th Street entrance (approx an 11 minute walk). 

Want to extend the fun beyond our picnic? There are lots of things to do in Central Park! Below are just a few ideas... (go to www.centralparknyc.org/  for a complete list of things to do.


·  Bethesda Fountain/Terrace http://www.centralpark.com/guide/attractions/bethesda-terrace/bethesda-fountain.html

·  Central Park Carousel (Open 10am - 6pm) http://www.centralpark.com/guide/attractions/carousel.html

·  Central Park Zoo (Open 10am-5:30pm) http://www.centralpark.com/guide/central-park-zoo.html

·  Conservatory Garden (Open 8am - dusk) http://www.centralpark.com/guide/attractions/conservatory-garden.html

·  Film screening of Superman II - free and outdoors ((Aug 29th – area open at 630pm, film starts at 8pm) http://www.centralpark.com/events/show/2735/central-park-film-festival-superman-ii

results.description:
Karuna and I got really organized for this MeetUp. Here's the fancy agenda. 

1st Hour 
30 min intro & chatter

• Let's get to know each other as we drift in. 

30 min writing warmup 

• Write outside your genre (or not. Just write). Examples: Poems, op/Ed, branding, blog, nonfiction, romance...anything your don't normally do. OR

• Observe an object -- anything in your view -- and write its life or what it thinks. Be as creative as you want. No rules.

2nd hour 

30 min: What's your daily ritual. How do you set time aside to write? Is it a habit, necessity, hobby? How much time do you spend each day/week/month? 

• We'll write for 10 minutes and have an informal discussion

30 min: What are your writing goals? You want to write something or you wouldn't be here. What do you want to write? 

Write about where you want your writing to be 1 year from now.

Do you write for money, passion or self esteem or something else?

What's your motivation?

Do you expect writing to pay your bills?

3rd hour

It's all about you & your work. Bring something you long for feedback.Allot for 10 minutes worth of copy -- but if we have a big group (and it’s hard to know) prepare for your best 5 minutes (about 130 words per minute).Reading your work is optional; listening is not. Please respect people sharing their work and offer positive constructive feedback.  Be nice. Don’t be shy.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a circle of chairs
results.name: Writing, discussion and projects

results.description:
Our next meetup will focus on: Purpose.

The meetup runs as follows:


1) The moderator selects one subject for discussion and a date for the meeting. Subjects can be as ephemeral as "love," "god," and "purpose," or as grounded as "politics," "environmentalism," and "family."

2) At the meetup, people are encouraged to propose a question related to the subject. The moderator will collect all of the questions in a list. Questions may also be proposed ahead of time online on the event page.

3) The group will then vote on the questions. In the first round of voting, each individual may vote for as many questions as they like. The top three will then go to a second round, where each individual may vote just once.

4) The question with the most votes is then discussed. Often, the discussion starts with a narrowing of the question, as it can be challenging to devise a question that can possibly be answered by a small group in just a couple of hours' discussion.

Finally, please consider making a small donation to help the moderator cover subscription costs.
results.name: Let's Talk About: Purpose

results.description:
"If you want to end your suffering, enter your pain." - Robert August Masters

Click Here to Register for Knowing Your Shadow

Too often, and for too many of us, our Shadow is running our lives - often without our even knowing it. Signs that shadow is running your life include:

• Over-reacting in certain situations 

• Numbing out, freezing, experiencing "brain fog" or sudden tiredness

• Facing recurring challenges and/or struggling to find true intimacy in your relationships 

• Feeling misunderstood and not seen

• Working constantly to feel ‘positive’ about things 

• Experience being highly critical or judgmental of yourself or others

• Avoiding anger, sadness, or other “difficult” emotions

• Watching yourself keep doing things you know are not good for you

• and many more 

If you are yearning for a freer, fuller, more vital life, you need to learn and practice the essential skills for working with Shadow effectively.

Click Here to Register for Knowing Your Shadow

When we are unable to embrace all of who we are, we end up pushing into the dark—our shadow—the aspects of ourselves that we find unpleasant or unlovable. We often take in the shaming voices from our past and they become an inner critic that puts us down, cuts us off, makes us small and can create genuine inner hell.

Left unconscious, our shadow will run our lives. Its subtle influence affects our relationships and especially robs us of our sense of innate wholeness and wellbeing. Our shadow territory can form a large part of who we are, so quick fixes or simplistic approaches won’t create lasting transformation.

There is so much energy and life force tied up in our shadow. This mini-workshop will introduce you to a robust and integrated approach that leads to genuine healing, transformation, and lifelong change. Shadow work is the single most important thing you can do to create a healthier, richer emotional life.

If you want more happiness, greater inner peace, and more rewarding, enriching and connected relationships, then learning how to turn towards and work with your shadow is essential.

Click Here to Register for Knowing Your Shadow

Iyeshka Farmer worked as a senior manager, fundraiser, facilitator, and change consultant to leaders for 15 years when she realized that many of these amazing, visionary and brilliant people were getting stuck in their own personal limitations. She embarked on a long journey over the past 10 years, studying with world leaders in many fields (including Dr. Robert Augustus Masters, Harrison Owen, Peggy Holman, Don Beck, Marilyn Hamilton, Birgitt Williams) to find the answers and tools to assist others in understanding and healing the deep unconscious patterns holding them back from achieving their greatest potential. 

Iyeshka is a Registered Professional Counsellor, Psychotherapist, and trauma healing specialist. She has studied Integral Intuitive Psychotherapy and Advanced Bodywork with Robert Augustus Masters and Diane Bardwell Masters since 2008 and is currently a core faculty member and Senior Teacher-Trainer with the Masters Center for Transformation.
results.name: Knowing Your Shadow: An Introduction to the Essential Skills with Iyeshka Farmer

results.description:
Honoring the 100th anniversary of the birth of Hoboken's most famous native son, "Frank Sinatra: The Man, the Voice, and the Fans," is now showing. The exhibit features interactive displays and videos, period-appropriate listening stations, and cherished fan photographs and artifacts to illustrate the singer/actor's formative years in Hoboken, highlights from his remarkable 60-year career, and memories from legions of fans. 

Sinatra was, as writer Bruce Bliven put it, "a kid from Hoboken who got the breaks." He emerged from a blue-collar, working class, urban setting, where most guys, he once told an audience, became fighters or worked in factories. 

He was born in a cold-water flat in a neighborhood of newly arrived immigrants in Southwest Hoboken. His big break came in 1935, when a Hoboken trio calling themselves the Three Flashes invited him to join them for a shot at the American Idol program of its day, the radio program, "Major Bowes and His Original Amateur Hour." He would go on to sell more records than any previous singer, and also to pursue a successful Hollywood film career, including an Oscar-winning performance in "From Here to Eternity." 

He and his pals in the "Rat Pack" defined the image of American cool in the 1950s and 60s, and he continued to tour and record successful records into his later years. When he died in 1998, fans swarmed Hoboken to mourn the man whose music and movies had meant so much to them.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 

DIRECTIONS- For a street map of Hoboken, including the location of the Hoboken Historical Museum at 1301 Hudson St., click here:

http://www.bing.com/maps/?FORM=Z9LH2#Y3A9NDAuNzUyMjgyfi03NC4wMjUxNzkmbHZsPTE2JnN0eT1yJnE9MTMwMSUyMEh1ZHNvbiUyMFN0JTIwSG9ib2tlbiUyQyUyME5KJTIwMDcwMzA=

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 

Arriving by Bus

Take the NJ Transit #126 bus from Port Authority (Gate 204) to Hoboken. Get off at 14th & Washington Streets and walk east to Hudson St. and one block south to 1301 Hudson. The fare from NY is $3.20 (pre-purchased ticket required; ticket-dispensing machines are located near the entrance to gate 204). The local bus fare from the PATH station is $1.50 (cash accepted, exact fare required) to ride up Washington Street to 13th Street, at the YMCA building. Walk one block east to the Museum.

To view bus schedules, click here:

http://www.njtransit.com/sf/sf_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=BusTo

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Arriving by PATH

The PATH train will bring you to NJ Transit's Hoboken Terminal. You'll be at the south end of town. To get from the PATH to the Museum, take either Washington Street bus (#126 or #89) to 13th St, then head east one block. The Museum is located in the old Shipyard Machine Shop at 13th Street & Hudson Street. Or, take a stroll; it only takes about 20 – 30 minutes to walk up the Hoboken waterfront, or historic residential Hudson Street, which is lined with some of Hoboken’s grandest homes, or “The Avenue,” aka Washington Street, lined with shops and restaurants.

To view PATH schedules, click here:

http://www.panynj.gov/path/full-schedules.html

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 

Arriving by Ferry

NY Waterway offers service to both Hoboken North and Hoboken South from terminals at 39th Street and the World Financial Center. From the Hoboken North stop, walk one block west along 14th Street to Shipyard Lane, and a block south to the Museum. The Hoboken South stop brings you to NJ Transit's Hoboken Terminal. See PATH directions to get from the terminal to the Museum.

To view FERRY schedules, click here:

http://www.nywaterway.com/ferryroutesschedules.aspx

Our start time is flexible.  Anyone needing lessons, though, should come around 1 pm.  Those of you without equipment (a bow, arrows, arm guard, glove) need to reserve club equipment once you RSVP yes.  There will be plenty of targets, and there is club equipment, free of charge as always, which will be available on a first-YES-RSVP, first-served basis.  

Take the LIRR southern line to the Wantagh train station. If taking a taxi from the train station to the park, tell the cabbie you want  Cedar Creek Park, Field 5. Once there, head south towards the playground. When you see it, keep the playground on your left.  The entrance to the range will be on your right.  You'll see us.

NB: If any drivers out there can swing by the Wantagh train station to collect folks coming on the LIRR from Manhattan, Brooklyn, and other points west, I'm sure the "city folk" would deeply appreciate it.  Post to this event if you are willing to do a "station run" from and/or to Wantagh station.

If driving, take the Southern State Parkway to Exit 27 South (Wantagh Parkway). Exit off the Wantagh Parkway at W6 (Merrick Road East). Continue down Merrick Road for approximately half-mile and look for the park entrance on your right.  The car fee is 10.00.

Park in Field 5 or as close to Field 5 as possible. Head towards the playground.  When you see it, walk south on the path with the playground on your left.  The entrance to the range will be on your right.

We will have a large  gazebo, and we will grab a picnic table.  Please BRING with you whatever you wish to eat and drink. The 2.00 fee covers extra water, any extra food we might need, gas, oil and any parking fees for those picking up people at the train station and/or bringing equipment.

results.description:
Hello New York Singer Songwriters,

I've been a singer/songwriter in NYC for 10 years and for the past 3 and a half I have owned my own rehearsal studio in Midtown Manhattan. When I first moved to New York I took recorded sound classes, but realized that my passion was the live show and I wanted to learn about live sound to make my shows better. Now I have this knowledge and I've noticed that there are no classes offered on this topic. It is vital knowledge. I taught my first class in March this year and because it was so successful I'm now regularly doing these workshops.

Below you will find the details and the link to reserve a spot.

I look forward to meeting you!

-Sarah

Live Sound Workshop for The Artist:

Saturday, August 29th, 2015 at 1PM

Youthquake Studios
584 Eighth AVE (between 38th and 39th ST)
New York, NY 10018 Order Now, Space is Very Limited! The workshop costs $75 and RVSP here to attend!...https://www.eventbrite.com/e/live-sound-workshop-for-the-artist-tickets-17992477986

What is "Live Sound?"

"Live Sound" is a term used to describe the sound techniques utilized in a live venue when there's an audience in attendance. This expertise is different than what's called "recorded sound," which is the way music is recorded in the recording studio.

Most classes and workshops exclusively focus on "recorded sound" techniques and can leave performers without vital skills when they go on stage to perform live. If you've ever taken ProTools classes or recording classes, you are still a beginner in live sound techniques and are in need of this workshop.

Is this Workshop for You?

This interactive live sound workshop is for you if you are doing gigs (or looking to do gigs) and want to know how to communicate clearly and professionally with the live sound engineers in NYC venues.

After completing the workshop you will also be able to do basic sound for yourself if you encounter the NYC venues that require this skill. (Surprisingly, there are some great ones that have the bartender point you to the mixer and leave you to do it all yourself!)

Who This Workshop is Not For

This is not for anyone who already has extensive live sound experience. This is a beginner level class geared towards performers.

If you are not a performer you are welcome to attend, but know that the class will be taught with the performer in mind.

Skills You'll Learn

• Mic Stand Setup Tricks
• Pro Cable Wrapping Techniques
• EQ, Compression, and Reverb
• Basics of the Mixer (Also known as a "Sound Board" or "Desk")
• Much More!

Questions You'll Be Able to Answer
• Why can't I hear myself?
• Why did I just hear that horrible feedback?
• What are the different pieces of gear all around the sound person?
results.name: Live Sound Workshop for The Artist - Paid Event

results.description:
Amanti Vino has offered our group early entry to their normally scheduled 2 p.m. wine tasting.  During this time there will be 4 wines available to sample.

This is great opportunity to take a break in your busy Saturday to taste some great wine, meet others in the group, and pose suggestions for future meet ups.  Given the limited space, the size of the event is limited to 60 people.  Parking is always tight in downtown Montclair. I recommend using the Crescent Deck behind Church Street. 

Weather permitting, Amanti Vino has a roped off area in front of the store where you can enjoy and share your purchases.  There a few rules:

1) Due to NJ Liquor laws, Amanti Vino cannot provide glasses. Please bring your own or purchase GO-VINO glasses for $3 each. Reusable and sturdy!

2) Please note that Amanti Vino cannot provide table service. Amanti Vino cannot open your bottle for you. You must open it yourself outside the shop and please do not bring open containers back into the store.

3) No smoking

results.description:
STORY
What Is the Story of Hedwig and the Angry Inch?Hedwig centers on an East German transsexual, “a slip of a girlyboy,” who moves to America after a botched sex change operation. As the show begins, Hedwig is performing in concert and recounting her life story: childhood abuse, a disastrous marriage to an American soldier and, after being plunked down alone in Kansas, a doomed romantic and songwriting partnership with a Christian teen who becomes a rock star. Hedwig remains obsessed with this former love, Tommy Gnosis, and follows him on the road, accompanied by her loyal new husband, Yitzhak. By the end, our heroine embraces the fullness of her identity in one of the most electrifying scenes on Broadway.


What Is Hedwig and the Angry Inch Like?On one level, Hedwig is an exciting rock concert powered by the charisma and sly humor of the glamorously bewigged, high-heeled title character. Songs like “The Origin of Love” are both gorgeous and thought-provoking, performed by Hedwig and a four-man band (The Angry Inch) and backed by the powerful vocals of Yitzhak, a role played by a woman. Beneath the laughs is the moving story of a heroine desperate to find love and a sense of self-worth. John Cameron Mitchell and Stephen Trask’s groundbreaking 1998 off-Broadway musical has bloomed into a long-running Broadway hit.

SEATS ARE LOCATED IN THE FRONT BALCONY

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

If so, come and join us for the Open Heart Meditation and Reiki Tummo energy balancing treatment. You will feel more relaxed and peaceful as Divine energy is channeled to everyone simultaneously.

What is Reiki energy healing?

Reiki is a simple way of channeling high vibration energy for healing purposes for ourselves or others. It clears blockages in our energy channels so that our physical body can be healthier. The practitioner does not use his/her energy, but is just a channel through which the energy flows. Reiki Tummo goes beyond traditional Reiki in that it is not just a healing modality, but also helps us to grow spiritually by opening our spiritual heart which is our connection to the Creator. Reiki Tummo also uses kundalini and earth energy for a deeper and gentler acceleration of cleansing and spiritual growth.

What else do I need to know?

Donations are gratefully accepted, but if you can't donate please feel free to come. Space is very limited so register early. Repeaters are always welcome. You may bring interested guests.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

results.description:
As we navigate our holistic journey as parents or are a main influence in a child's life, it is helpful to have the support of other like minded individuals. This meeting gives us a chance to share our journeys and provide new ideas for what may be beneficial to us. Our journeys range from buying our first piece or organic produce to buying food from the same local farm for years. Please do not feel your holistic journey is too new or you have been doing this too long to not benefit from this conversation. Come join for an afternoon in sharing and connecting with other moms, dads and caregivers around holistic parenting journeys.

Our August meeting will be dedicated to getting to know each other better and to sharing our holistic passions.

We have 2 topics we'd like to cover:

1. sharing interesting cultural or family tips that have been passed down in the family, maybe even through a few generations

2. sharing a holistic or organic item or a tip that you use on a daily basis and how it helps your family or child to thrive (maybe you produce some healthy products* - please feel free to bring those to give away or sell; *only home-made products)

One of the main objective of Holistic Moms Network along the education is community creation. We want that each of us feels that there's a true spirit of support among us and that we can openly and fearlessly share our philosophies, concerns, passions...

We've recently had a lot of new members joined and have not had a chance to meet with some older members either.

Let's gather together in a holistic spirit of sharing.

We hope to see many of you that day!!!!

***************************************************************
Children are always welcome! Babywearing prefered over strollers due to limited space.

Let's all be mindful about our space. We have a limited and separated space within the store and we want to stay there.
results.name: Share and connect in holistic parenting journey

results.description:
The Museum of Modern Art and MoMA PS1 announce Andrés Jaque / Office for Political Innovation as the winner of the annual Young Architects Program (YAP) in New York. Now in its 16th edition, the Young Architects Program at MoMA and MoMA PS1 has been committed to offering emerging architectural talent the opportunity to design and present innovative projects, challenging each year’s winners to develop creative designs for a temporary, outdoor installation at MoMA PS1 that provides shade, seating, and water.


Tickets $18 in advance, $20 day-of

MoMA PS1 presents Warm Up 2015, beginning June 27 and taking place every Saturday this summer through September 5. A New York summer staple now in its 18th year, MoMA PS1’s highly anticipated Warm Up outdoor music series continues its tradition of introducing audiences to the best in experimental live music, sound, and DJs—both local and international—across a range of genres. Warm Up supports both established and emerging artists by creating a platform that allows for experimentation and providing a space for collaboration, new material, and side projects.

The series is programmed by a curatorial committee selected by the museum to represent a wide spectrum of expertise and experience in music, sound, and the performing arts, resulting in a unique lineup of artists that explore, interpret, and combine genres. Selected by Klaus Biesenbach, Director, MoMA PS1, and Chief Curator at Large, The Museum of Modern Art; and organized by Margaret Knowles, Curatorial Assistant and Warm Up Producer, MoMA PS1, the Warm Up 2015 curatorial committee includes Dean Bein, Head of True Panther Sounds; Jonathan Galkin, Co-Founder of DFA Records; Eliza Ryan; Brandon Stosuy, Senior Editor for Pitchfork; Imogene Strauss, of Cool Managers; Matt Werth, Label Head of RVNG Intl.

Warm Up will feature rotating stage installations by local New York design talent.

For more infomation, visit http://momaps1.org/warmup/

results.description:
Three distinct neighborhoods in Manhattan with unique beats yet connected in proximity and creativity. Come explore SoHo’s architectural treasures and learn of its art, shopping, culture and more. We will also experience how Italians have shaped  the most iconic Italian enclave in the U.S. We then later finish exploring sections on the largest Chinatown in North America.

Itinerary: 
• SoHo’s Cast-Iron District 
• Richard Haas Mural on Spring St. 
• Haughwout Building 
• The Italian American Museum 
• Church of the Most Precious Blood 
• Mahayana Buddhist Temple 
• Columbus Park 
• And More

Experience a cultural patrimony that will connect you to sections of New York and also the world.


Reservations: 
Required. You must RSVP. Please, if you RSVP and later realize you will not be able to attend change your reservation ASAP.


Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the Apple Store in SoHo on 103 Prince St. map here (Prince St. side). Tour concludes at Columbus Park map here.


Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.


Some of the Sights we will experience:


I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!

results.description:
I keep an eye on the weather and the field.  In the case of inclement weather - I try to make a determination as early as possible - preferably 24+ hours in advance, or by noon the day of if it's still questionable.  If we are not meeting, I will actually cancel the event page and send out an email.  If you are not signed up to receive emails, check the site, or text me[masked]


Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc.   If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF.  If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...).  If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.



What is Ultimate Frisbee?  In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee.  You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Montclair)

results.description:
WHAT: Starting in Manhattan, join a whole bunch of gorgeous and sane singles from multiple meetup groups as we walk across the Brooklyn Bridge followed by the Manhattan Bridge and finally the Williamsburg Bridge and finishing off the walk at Smorgasburg in Williamsburg. You can expect a day of amazing views, awesome photo opps, babbling endlessly with TONS of gorgeous hotties, and gobbling up serious amounts of yummy snacks. 

WHERE: We will meet here as seen below. As you can see there are many subway stations encompassing this location: 

WHEN: The meeting time is 3 PM. We will wait 30 minutes for everyone to arrive. The walk will commence at exactly 3:30. If you are even 30 seconds late you will miss us and we will not wait. 

HOW TO FIND US: Look for the big group of people standing around talking to each other. If we're hard to spot, please do not hesitate to call the organizer Beau at [masked]

PACE: The pace of the walk will be moderate/mid-paced. 

DURATION: Approximately 2.5 hours 

DISTANCE: 6.1 miles from point A to point B 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

results.description:
Gentrification may have taken its toll on Old New York, but a handful of old neighborhood dives still remain, so we'll check out a few on this end-of-summer bar crawl.

We'll start out at a bar we didn't all get to at our last meetup: Milano's Bar. Dating to 1923, with bars on this site since the 1880s, Milano's is the last of the original Bowery bars at this end of Houston. Its walls are practically a photographic history of New York. It's a classic long, narrow dive, but join us in the back where there's a bit more room.

From there we'll head east on Houston to Avenue A and The Library. Yes, there are shelves of books, B-movies projected on the back wall, punk rock on the jukebox and a collection of skulls displayed year-round.

We'll continue east on Houston to the Parkside Lounge. In a building that was once an ice house on the East River and a stop on the Underground Railroad, the Parkside now hosts bands and comedians in the evenings and is a popular spot for celebrity-spotting. Oh and did we mention it's haunted?

Finally, we'll head up Avenue B to Vazac's Horseshoe Bar. Originally part of a Polish catering hall that dates to 1935, Vazac's, also known as 7B, and its namesake bar have been featured in several movies, including The Godfather II,  Crocodile Dundee, The Verdict, Angel Heart, and Serpico, along with multiple  episodes of Law and Order.

So come join us for an afternoon/evening of cheap beer, vintage arcade games, punk rock, authentic vibes, and old New York grit. Before it's all gone.
results.name: End of Summer Dive Bar Crawl: Milano's, Library, Parkside Lounge, Vazac's

results.description:
How about a Korean martial arts movie at AMC Empire 25 in Times Square? It's the 4:10 pm showing.

Synopsis:

"As the greed and excess of a corrupt Monarchy threatens to destroy the once-glorious Goryeo Dynasty, three legendary warriors lead a revolt to overthrow the empire and save its people. But when deceit and betrayal costs the life of a master swordsman, a plot for justice and revenge is set into motion, raging for decades between the two survivors. From the director of CHILDREN OF HEAVEN and starring Byung-hun Lee (THE GOOD, THE BAD, THE WEIRD, TERMINATOR GENISYS), MEMORIES OF THE SWORD is a lavish epic that blends tragic historical drama with thrilling swordplay and martial arts."

Korean with English Subtitles

results.description:
Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

This is an example of an opportunity box, there is a lot of variety and it is subject to change. 

Spring Lake Farms is offering a Mixed box ~(The farmer will target 25 lbs but may vary depending on cuts. )

Spring Lake Farms is offering a sampler mix pack.  This pack will consist of BEEF & PORK

These animals were butchered at various times throughout the year and the date is labelled on each cut.   I do not know exactly how many of each cut , but I can assure you that Spring Lake Farms is always extremely generous in their sampler packs.  They aim to please their discerning meat eating customers.


THE FARMER'S WILL NOT BE PROVIDING AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX IN ADVANCE.  THEY HAVE AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX POSTED TO EACH BOX ON DELIVERY DAY. 

The total cost for your beef/pork mix box will be $143.92. The box is $135 plus a $5 meetup fee plus a $3.92 paypal fee.  

THE FARMERS WILL NOT BE DELIVERING TO INDIVIDUAL ADDRESSES MIX BOXES ALONE.  PLEASE COME AND PICK UP YOUR MIX BOX.  EXCEPTION - 2 OR MORE PEOPLE GETTING TWO SHIPMENTS WOULD LIKE TO HAVE IT DELIVERED TO THE SAME PLACE - THEY WILL DELIVER FOR THAT. 

Spring Lake has a great website <a>www.springlakefarmny.com.</a> Ulla Kjarval, the farmer's daughter also writes a farming & food blog with several recipes to complement the meat her parent's raise. Our beef has been completely grass-fed. Ingi Kjarval, our farmer, has been cross-breeding his cattle to help build a smaller, sturdier steer that does well in upstate NY on grass. Our cows are part Simmental, Hereford, Angus & Highland.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches with the number 8 above them inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

results.description:
"Something's wrong with the world and I don't know what it is.

It used to be better, of course it did. In the golden age of legend, when there was enough to eat and enough hope, when there was one nation under god and people could lift their eyes and see beyond the horizon, beyond the day. Children were born happy and grew up rich.

Now that's not what we've got. Now we've got *this.*"

I've played and run quite a few games Powered by the Apocalypse (Dungeon World, Monsterhearts), but I hadn't given the original a real chance -- so hey, here I am doing that now!

My thought is to do a bi-weekly/monthly session depending on fluctuating interest -- every session, a new apocalypse. Typically running around 5-6 hours in length, and set-up for 2-6 players, they'll likely take place during Fri-Sun, starting in the late afternoons. Please let me know what dates work for you, or I will go ahead with the tentative plan to have the first session on 8/23 at 4:30pm.

Requests to revisit environments and previous characters are always fine by me, provided everyone present is alright with that. I may be limiting which playbooks can be used -- which ones likely to change depending on the environment and session. First up: desert dystopia a la Tank Girl and Mad Max -- all that stands between you and oblivion are few grains of sand, the blood spilled on them, and whether or not fortune feels like smiling on your blistering, sun-scorched scalp. Are you willing to fight against your creeping extinction for another day, or are you just a load of festering road-kill waiting to happen?
results.name: Welcome to the Apocalypse (Single-Session Apocalypse World)

results.description:
Of course you’ve seen them—the massive cast-iron and masonry buildings that line 6th Avenue and Broadway just above Union Square, today holding Trader Joe, Bed, Bath, & Beyond, and ABC Carpets. But who built these behemoths, and what kind of emporia could fill these entire structures? Let’s answer those questions by discovering the booming shopping culture of Gilded Age New York, from the late 1870s just up to the outbreak of World War I, along an area so crowded with women shoppers that it was dubbed in after years “The Ladies’ Mile”. Along the way, we’ll hear about the millionaires who lived here first, like eccentric miser Peter Goelet and audacious August Belmont (upon whom Edith Wharton based unscrupulous Julius Beaumont in The Age of Innocence); the great merchant princes, including philanthropic businessman Benjamin Altman and  “fighting Irishman” Hugh O’Neill; the shop girls, counter-jumpers, and child laborers who served here by the thousands; and luminaries from the entertainment world also populating the district, like Shakespearean actor Edwin Booth and the mysterious “Ajeeb”. Throw in a Richard Upjohn church and a secluded Jewish cemetery, and it’s a neighborhood full of fascinating “survivor” structures.  

Where to meet: Meet to the side of the Best Buy, SE corner of 23 Street and 6 Avenue.

When to meet: 4:45 for a 5pm start. I will be holding a sign that reads, "Ladies' Mile".

Train: Take the F to "23 Street" and 6 Avenue; Otherwise, take the E, C to  "23 Street" on 8 Avenue, and walk down.

Fee: $20 cash, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age; exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins.

The tour will be approximately 2.5 hours long. For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella.  While Friendly Native tours usually do take place on the date and at the time they are scheduled, on occasion they will be postponed in cases of high temperatures or high probability of rain,  and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event. 

The nearest restrooms to this location are inside the stores and eateries on 6 Avenue.  Please be sure to "take care of things" before the start of the tour!
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a sign reading LADIES MILE
results.name: The LADIES' MILE: Shopping District of the Gilded Age!

results.description:
The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
As a naturally intuitive soul, have you ever felt challenged, stressed, alone, or caught up in indecision by your sensitivity?  Life on planet earth in this 21st century can often feel like riding a roller-coaster to a sensitive. We tune into many different energies daily. But how much do we discern and understand what we sense, and then effectively take action to keep us moving forward positively?

The Pisces Full Moon and the beginning of the Spiritual New Year (that happens every September 1) is a great time to tune into the Light and your sensitivity to gain some insights and renew your personal direction and well-being.  

We will share a special "readings" session to help you project for this new wave of energy, including some key insights for each of you. We will also do targeted Angel Connection Techniques for your specific needs - physical, mental and spiritual. 

We have some new spiritual techniques to share with you from our international conferences, as well as tools to help you go deeper in working with your angels, life purpose and practical intuition.

We’ll also share on some upcoming programs that can help you keep your energy and discernment high, so that no matter what is happening in your world, you can be your own best intuitive self! 

You are welcome to bring a friend.   There is no charge for this fellowship Meetup!  


It is great to be back in NYC after our spring and summer travels.  We want to welcome the new Meetup Members and look forward to meeting everyone!

It is the spirit that unites us!   Love and light!

Dr. Paul Kellogg and Dr. Susan Kellogg

www.soul2soulliving.com

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

8/29: 5:15pm till 7:30pm (or longer if the conversation is still full of juice at that time)!

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.name: A Conversation About Happiness, Citicorp at 53rd and Lex.

Meeting point - In the shoulder of route 9D immediately where it begins off of the bridge - Start time is 5:30 pm.  If you're late, you are welcome to catch up with us on the way or at the top. Parking Is on the shoulder of 9D.

We will ascend up the face (rock scramble), reconvene & socialize at the top, then descend down the trail (walkable). Feel free to bring a snack and/or beverage to share at the top.

Fast hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers so please feel comfortable hiking alone should you get separated.

---

Distance: About 3 miles


Gain: About 700 feet - rock scramble

Event should run 3-4 hours.

Working headlamp, map & 2 liters hydration.

---

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.  Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: TONIGHT - Anthony's Nose Sunset & Social Hike

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

Each week will have a theme picked for that day to work with, discuss, and draw. I think these themed meetups will be exciting and give artists a more common focus, this will be a great exercise to either draw something their familiar with, curious about trying, wanting to learn, or to experiment with and challenge themselves with something new.

These meetups will be focused on creating art, sketches, and ideas with a central focus depending on the theme and be a slightly different from our casual meetups. The meetup will be split into three parts: First conceptual thumbnail sketches and warm-up exercises, then spend an hour and a half on drawing, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be more drawing focused! 

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC.

results.description:
"I feel like I acquired a semester's worth of knowledge in one class! Instructor made learning really fun and cared about the students having a great experience. A+" M.S.

Beginner: Improving Your Drawings

* This Meetup is structured as a drawing class. It is limited to 7 students. 

This class is for you if you are relatively new to drawing and want direction on how to proceed. This class is for beginners and for people who consider themselves beginners.

Each student receives personal instruction and technical advice based on their drawings during the session. 

The Class:

1) We will begin with a short Q & A session where we answer some common questions:  Do I begin with one tiny piece or do I try to get the whole image on the paper? How do I make sure things fit on the page? How do I draw more in proportion? etc... 

2) Together we head into the galleries to work on our first drawing exercise. I will sit with each student to discuss their work and make sure the lesson is understood and effective.

3) We meet briefly to discuss our work, ask any questions and get our next exercise. 

4) We set out to draw again. And again I visit with each student to talk about their work. 

5) Finally we meet to discuss what we have learned and answer any final questions. 

Students should bring a drawing pad, a 2H pencil, a HB pencil, a 4B pencil, an eraser and a pencil sharpener. 


If you have any questions please feel free to email me. 

Simon

_______________________________________________

Please note: this event is not affiliated with The Metropolitan Museum of Art.

Museum admission is not included in the event cost. Museum tickets are suggested only and you may pay as much as little as you wish.
