results.description:
I've caught the night hiking bug like most of you have seemed to have also. It's time to tackle one of my favorite hikes in the evening light or lack thereof. You know what they say right? Go big or go home! And I ain't ready to go home yet.

If you don't know, now you know ...

Named one of the 10 best hikes in the country, Breakneck Ridge steeply climbs the mountainside up from the Hudson River, and has many spectacular views of the Hudson Valley and surrounding area. If you're from the tri-state area and haven't done this hike then you haven't really hiked. I won't beat around the bush -- this is a tough one with very challenging terrain to cover, we'll be doing some serious rock scrambling and tackling some near vertical ascents but the reward is well worth the effort.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is an intermediate/advanced level hike of about 6 miles and I recommend that attendees be in good cardiovascular shape -- being a triathlete isn't necessary but "exercise" shouldn't be a four-letter word to you. There are numerous rock scrambles and a 1,260 foot elevation gain so be prepared for a challenge.

• Also, if you have a fear of heights this might not be a good hike for you. There are areas where you will skirt along ledges and near lengthy drop offs.


• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate -- we'll be stopping to take in the views and smell the flowers. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• Dress in layers of non-cotton clothing, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat, bring 3 liters of fluid, a packed dinner and/or snacks, and sunscreen. DON'T FORGET YOUR HEADLAMP AND EXTRA BATTERIES.


• Rain cancels the hike.

• No guests allowed, sorry.

• RSVP only if you seriously plan to attend as space is limited. If you RSVP and I notice you have a number of no shows or a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

How to get there ....

By Train:
Take the Metro-North East Hudson Line to the Cold Spring station, the 4:17 PM train from Grand Central gets you there at 5:29 PM. Walk about 1.5 miles up route 9D to the trailhead, which if you stroll slowly will take you about 25 minutes. The trailhead starts right after you pass through a highway tunnel (See photo below.). The off peak round-trip train fare is $26.50. I'm targeting to finish this hike in time to catch the 11:20 PM train back to NYC from Cold Spring.


By Car:
Take the Palisades Interstate Parkway to its Northern terminus at the Bear Mountain Bridge. Cross the bridge and proceed north on N.Y. Route 9D for about 8.5 miles to the Village of Cold Spring. Continue ahead on Route 9D for another two miles past the intersection with N.Y. Route 301 in Cold Spring. Immediately after passing through a tunnel under Breakneck Ridge, park in the small parking area on the left (West) side of the road. (See photo below. If this parking area is full, continue north for another 0.2 mile to a much larger parking area on the West side of the road).
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics: Breakneck Ridge Sunset/Night Hike

results.description:
Full Moon Meditation, Kirtan and Dinner - The full-moon night is the best for meditation. Many people who have become Buddha’s have attained their enlightenment on the full-moon night, even Buddha himself.

It may have been a coincidence, but it is significant to remember: he was born on the full-moon night, he became enlightened on the full-moon night and he died on the full-moon night.

Something in the full moon seemed to be synchronizing with his energy. Use it. Be alert and use every possibility to help you go in. Once you are awakened, then there is no problem. Then you can be at ease, at rest, at peace, anywhere.

The Dhammapada: The Way of the Buddha, Vol 11, Chapter 7
results.name: Full Moon Meditation, Kirtan & Dinner

results.description:
Sponsored by StackExchange and Invision App. Join us for free beer, wine and hors d'oeuvres after the hackathon. 

Meetup members Save 10% on Deluxe Passes: If you would like to attend both the Hackathon and the After Party, there are discounted tickets on Eventbrite.

</a>

<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ux-hackathon-the-science-behind-conversion-tickets-18156010115?discount=nycuxspecial">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ux-hackathon-the-science-behind-conversion-tickets-18156010115?discount=nycuxspecial

RSVP to just the After Party here.

About the Hackathon After Party 

At 6:30pm, after the hackathon, we’ll segue into the mixer event. Have your fill of FREE beer, wine, and hors d'oeuvres. This a is great opportunity to socialize and network with industry professionals.

About the Hackathon [separate tickets required]

The goal of UX Hackathon is to teach you effective strategies for creating powerful online experiences. If you are new to UX, consider this your crash course. This event is a great opportunity to see first hand what methods UX designers use to increase purchasing and user sign up. We’ll dive into common tools like Sketch App and Invision for prototyping. Learn to build a clickable wireframe that’ll turn guests into consumers. For more advanced designers, get to know the science behind the best websites and apps. Prizes and recognition await the team that builds the best clickable wireframe.


UX Hackathon Details

To kick off the day, Laurence Adrian, senior UX designer at Dom & Tom will lead a presentation on what biological and psychological factors influence our decisions and what strategies UX designers can use to create high conversion websites. After the presentation, we'll review methods for rapid prototyping using Sketch & Invision App.


Now you're ready to build your own clickable wireframe for onboarding and purchasing!


At 12:00 O'clock, we’ll break for lunch. There will be FREE pizza, snacks, and refreshments! Attendees will then have the opportunity to form teams. Each team will be given a use case to develop a high conversion onboarding experience using Sketch and Invision App. At this time feel free to ask questions and get help building your clickable wireframe (prototype).

At 4:00 O'clock, each team will have five minutes to present their prototype to a panel of judges.

At 5:15, the winning team will be announced and crowned victorious.


Hackathon Prizes & Giveaways!

For those who attend the hackathon

• One-year free InVision Starter Plan for winning team

• 3-month trial plan for all attendees

• Raffling three (3) full-licenses of Sketch App

Rules

By attending the event, you agree to the rules and terms set forth.

results.name: UX Hackathon: After Party

results.description:
Full Moon Meditation: This Year we have The August Full Moon on The 29th Known as a SuperMoon.

This August brings a "perigee" full Moon.  This is the time each month when the Moon is nearest to Earth in its orbit. In other words, the full Moon coincides with perigee this August.

When this happens, there are some physical effects, such as elevated tides. All full Moons raise the Earth's tides, however, a full Moon at perigee elevates tides further. 

In recent years, the term "Supermoon" has become popular. It's just a catchy way to say "perigee full Moon." In fact, there will be three Supermoons before the end of the year—in August, September and October.

Some Native American tribes called the August Moon the "Sturgeon Moon" because they knew that the sturgeon of the Great Lakes and Lake Champlain were most readily caught during this full Moon. They also called this month's Moon the Full Green Corn Moon. 

Different tribes had different Moon name preferences. Other examples for August are: Wheat Cut Moon (San Ildefonso, and San Juan), or "Moon When All Things Ripen" (Dakotah Sioux) or "Blueberry Moon" (Ojibway).


We all have a fascination with the moon and the stars.  But did you ever wonder what the different phases of the moon actually mean and most of all how they affect you?

Your invited to spend some time with us at the Healing House to learn about these changes in our skies and to participate in a group meditation and learn about basic moon rituals.

We are going to kick off with a FULL MOON MEDITATION with a Crystal BOWL MEDITATION.  Our guest Crystal Bowl Player will be Mr. Matthew Rosett.  Meditation with crystal bowl singing in the background can change your experience and is a truly amazing!!

New Comers Are Welcome and Encouraged!

Here's what members are saying about our Moon Meditations:  

"There are no words to describe how powerful this was. An eye opening experience is what it was for me. Thanks to his experience I see my life going in a completely different direction"

“ I went to my first crystal bowl healing here and what an experience it was. I enjoyed it to every extent and plan on attending more ( if not all), future bowl crystal meetups ” 

Suggestion for Meditation: If You have a Yoga Mat or Cushion, Please bring it along for Comfort and Personal Meditation Space.
results.name: Join Us For August "Supermoon" Full Moon/Crystal Singing Bowl Meditation

results.description:
RSVP for car camping at the Adirondacks! Car Camping & Day Hikes if you want to camp at Shap Bridge with us.

There is still space on this trip: Just add yourself to the waiting list and send me a quick message regarding your experience with the challenges listed above. I'll give you a spot if you have the experience. 


---------

---------------------------------------


I've been working through the slides of the Adirondacks. They are by far my favorite routes, but they are difficult hikes involving:

- Off-trail hiking and navigation 

- Difficult bushwhacking 

- Scrambling (class III and IV) and short sections of easy-but-unprotected rock climbing (<5.5)

- Long sections of friction climbing up the slabs themselves. The risk is low but looking down a 1000' slide can be intimidating if you have any fear of heights. 

Anyone who wishes to come needs experience with all of those challenges. 

The Hikes: 


Saturday - Long day hike up the 1st slide. 

Sunday - Shorter slide, hitting the road by 2pm

Gear:  

Standard day hiking gear: map & knowledge of how to read it & ability to follow a trail, lunch/snack, water, rain gear, headlamp, extra warm layer

Special gear: Bring leather gloves for scrambling and a long-sleeved shirt/pants for bushwhacking. (No shorts!)  

------------------


This is not a guided trip. You are responsible for your own safety. That means you must understand the planned route and have the necessary experience and equipment to complete it independently of the group if necessary. Participants do not always maintain the same pace or stay together as a group.
results.name: ADK Slide Bagging - Part 1

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nht22dMzZXw

Upscale Soulmate Connections offers singles the chance to mingle, connect and network with people for business and personal requirements and invites sponsors for the same.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4CamTaEOW2E

With a tight day to day schedule, many of us don’t get much time to get out a bit and socialize. From the start of the day to the end, we’re so booked with work, that we don’t get time for ourselves. In the process, we lose the golden opportunity to do one of the most important things in life- make friends, connect with people and have fun!

There are many ways for you to do this. You can always join a club, start yoga lessons in your free time, or simply create a profile on online dating or networking websites. But here’s the real challenge; how do you make time for these things when you’re too busy to even indulge in a proper breakfast most of the days?

It is precisely for this reason that Upscale Soulmate Connections is hosting the It’s A Love Thing Singles Mixer Night. The event has been organized to provide today’s chic singles with the opportunity to connect with each other for business, as well as personal requirements.

Organized by Gwendolyn Boatright, CEO and Founder of Upscale Soulmate Connections and a professional matchmaker herself, the event is anticipated to draw individuals in the 30 plus, 40 plus and 50 plus age bars for a fun, interactive night, and will expand to New Jersey, Florida, North Carolina, South Carolina and Texas.

The event aims to present an exciting opportunity for all guests to connect with others. Special Guests the talented singer Petawane. In addition a special guest DJ will keep guests in good spirits with his toe-tapping numbers at the event.

Come join us for a night of absolute fun and don’t miss out on the opportunity to meet someone special. This event is a must-attend if you’re looking to change all of that. Hurry tickets are selling fast.

Tickets for this event can be paid at the door or at Eventbrite or Brown Paper Tickets.

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/its-a-love-thing-mixer-tickets-16048348041?aff=ehomesaved

http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/1658604

Price includes:

Prizes and Appetizers, Open Bar, Great Performers, Music , Free Database.

ALL TICKET SALES ARE FINAL

General Admission For Women -   $15.00

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

I have also scheduled this walk on Monday afternoon, September 7th, which is Labor Day; and Saturday evening, September 12th.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo. Thank you again.

Description: During the Gilded Age, Americans achieved wealth as never as before. In New York, the opera, the theatre, and grand parties consumed the ruling class' leisure hours. Sherry's Restaurant hosted formal horseback dinners for the New York Riding Club. Mrs. Stuyvesant Fish once threw a dinner party to honor her dog who arrived sporting a $15,000 diamond collar. Millionaires built stately and often gaudy homes in New York City. For example, the childhood home of Huguette Clark, built in 1907 by her father, William Andrews Clark, had 121 rooms, 31 baths, four art galleries, a swimming pool, and a private underground rail line to bring in coal for heating. It cost Clark $7M—that's about $162M in today's dollars—to build, but stood for only 20 years, bought by a developer after Clark's death for less than half the construction cost and demolished to make way for a wealthy apartment house at 960 Fifth Avenue.

On this walking tour, we will discuss rich people's grand mansions, wraparound terraces, extravagant weddings, lavish parties, oversized carriage houses, conspicuous leisure, costly hobbies, spacious apartments, prissy social clubs, and wealth fest.

This is a walking tour with much commentary. We'll be walking about 2 1/2 miles. We will be zigzagging around historic Carnegie Hill and the Upper East Side. There will be plenty of stopping at points of interest. If you don't like a lot of stopping, then this type of walk is not good for you. The tour lasts about 2 1/2 hours.

Below was the Carnegies’ organ in the reception hall. One of the functions of the organ was an alarm clock. (Smithsonian Institute [Unidentified Photographer

Below is from The New York Times, December 28, 1905.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time/Place: The meeting time is (after dinner) at 7:15 PM. The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Barnes & Noble Bookstore at 150 East 86th Street, near Lexington Avenue. Before the walk, restrooms are available in Barnes & Noble.

Transportation Options: Take the 4, 5, or 6 subway train to 86th Street and Lexington Avenue.

Finishing Time/Place: This walk will finish at about 9:50 PM on the Upper East Side near 79th Street and Park Avenue. If you are planning to take a subway train, you can then get the No. 6 train at 77th Street/Lexington Avenue OR the No. 4, 5, or 6 trains at 86th Street/Lexington Avenue.

Rainy weather cancels this walk. Therefore, if it is raining, or the forecast is for rainy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post the cancellation notice in the Discussion Board.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Below was one of the Payne Whitney's wedding presents, which was under construction. Payne Whitney also received a steam yacht as a wedding present. (Photo MCNY [Unidentified Photographer circa 1903])


Below are two photos of the interior of the Payne Whitney's "wedding present" house at 972 Fifth Avenue, which was designed by architect/art collector/interior designer Stanford White. (Photos MCNY [Unidentified Photographer circa 1905])

Below is from The New York Times, March 8, 1902

---------------------------------------------------------------

Located in the background was brand-new 998 Fifth Avenue , which was the first luxury apartment house on upper Fifth Avenue. (Photos Library of Congress [George Grantham Bain circa 1912])
results.name: History of Rich People during Gilded Age and Beyond - Walking Tour (August 29)

Лента повествует о захватывающем восхождении троих профессиональных альпинистов (Чина, Конрада Анкера и Ренана Оцтурка) по одной из самых сложных и опасных в мире стен — почти отвесному и гладкому «Акульему плавнику» длиной в 457 м, который находится рядом с пиком Меру (высота 6660 м) в Гималаях.

На Меру нет базовых лагерей, нет шерпов и нет туристов: команде потребовалось несколько экспедиций, чтобы самим разбить лагерь и доставить в горы все необходимое. Так уж получилось, что лагерем стала палатка на высоте 6000 м, прикрепленная к скальной стене.

"Songs of the Soul: Sri Chinmoy Tribute Concert"
Featuring the legendary Indian classical violinist Dr. L. Subramaniam and family:

Songs of the Soul is proud to present Dr. L. Subramaniam in a tribute concert dedicated to Sri Chinmoy. Dr Subramaniam will be accompanied by Kavita Krishnamurti, Bindu Subramaniam and Ambi Subramaniam.

Dr Subramaniam is India’s foremost violinist. Raised in the Carnatic South Indian Classical tradition, he is famous worldwide for the diversity of his contribution to the World of Music. The pioneer of what is known as Global Fusion, he is a Maestro in the Western Classical, Jazz and North Indian styles, collaborating with artists such as Yehudi Menuhin, Jean Luc Ponty and Stanley Clarke.

results.description:
Come join us as we dance around the fire in Glen Rock NJ to share our transformative journeys in SiStarhood!

Please RSVP YES for the address.
A separate group email will be sent to those that are intending to join in the festivities.

This, the 9th Moon of the year we are exploring the energy of the Initiator Goddess - sometimes known as Isis! 

We will dance, share food and conversation about our loves and passions. This is a time to allow ourselves to BE with each other in SiStarhood. This is time to build our bonds and heal our hurts.  Whatever is brought forth is just right. Being RED TENT inspired, this circle is a safe space to share all that is true for you in the moment!


Each woman who attends is a unique jewel and has unique gifts to offer, allow spirit to guide you. Bring what you like including your requests!

Each circle is a special experience, women leave feeling, energized, relaxed, heard, loved, seen, fulfilled and more connected to their soul and to each other.

The suggested donation is $25 to attend the event. Sliding scale available.

The wisdom of the circle is from the variety of the perspectives brought forth. This is a place where a woman can remove her masks and forget about 'fitting in'. Actually, we celebrate our BEingness in all of the glorious colors and shapes.

Looking forward to sharing time with each of you.

Holding each of you in loving arms,

Lisa & Liz

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

results.description:
Tickets: https://goo.gl/2pvdAl

The drinks are on us as you join world-renowned mixologist and raconteur Anthony Caporale for a boozy romp through the history of spirits and cocktails in this critically-acclaimed new play with drinks and music. 
Combining Anthony's encyclopedic knowledge of beverage history and decades of bartending experience with his legendary skills as a storyteller and entertainer, The Imbible treats audiences to a completely original and thoroughly enjoyable evening of theatre. 

https://youtu.be/ZIIdlSHp1f4

Playing in an authentic New York speakeasy that was actually used as a meeting place by the notorious Tammany Society, The Imbible sweeps audiences along a 10,000-year journey through history and across the globe accompanied by craft cocktails and the vocal stylings of The Backwaiters acapella group! 

Sit back and enjoy the music and drinks while Anthony holds forth on the history and science behind alcoholic beverages, traces their economic and political impact on our cultural development, conducts live demonstrations of brewing beer and distilling spirits, guides the audience through cocktail tastings, and - like any good bartender - keeps his guests laughing throughout the night. 

3 craft cocktails are included. 

Tickets: https://goo.gl/2pvdAl

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.

Join New Jersey Singles 30's & 40's For A Summer Shindig @ Shannon Rose Tonight! 2 Meetup Groups. The Age Range For This Meetup Is 30 to 50.

Starting @ 8pm we'll meet at the big bar as soon as you walk in. Drink, eat, mingle & socialize.

At 10pm we can checkout Under Pressure playing live. 

Under Pressure is an eclectic party band that has a unique take on Top 40’s hits mashed with everyones favorite country, oldies, classic rock, hip-hop and 90’s sing-a-longs.  Driven by high-energy female vocals and underlying harmonies, the band creates an unforgettable night-out experience, all while creating real music with real instruments.

Free Parking & No Cover! If there lot is full you can park in the big Target lot.

results.description:
***Please RSVP AFTER You Have Paid***


My good friend Reb Orrell did an over-night photography trip to NYC recently, and some of the members of this group wanted to emulate that trip and some of the incredible images that he got. Here are a few:

https://scontent-lga1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11140025_10206022385473020_3801480245590060033_n.jpg?oh=662d8af8fe0ddb7a535e37c023e86a3c&oe=55E82DC9


Here is the perfect opportunity to spend an unusual fun filled nighttime of walking, chatting, and photographing some of the very cool bridges and scenes in New York City with David Blecman and Steve Rosenbach leading the way.


The cost is only $99 per person and INCLUDES: 

Two Awesome Instructors
A Pre-Planned Itinerary
One-on-One Instruction on GETTING the Shots

We Leave and Return from the White Marsh MTA Park & Ride. Click Here for Map

</a>

<a href="https://www.google.com/maps/place/MTA+Maryland+-+White+Marsh+Park+and+Ride/@39.377956,-76.461731,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0xe1f30886041659e2">


 Approximate itinerary: 

•Meet at the White Marsh Park and Ride - 5:00 pm
 •Leave White Marsh Park & Ride - 5:30 pm 
•Arrive New York - 8:30pm 
•Depart NYC: 6:00 am
•Arrive at the White Marsh Park and Ride: 9:00 am

Bus ticket, bumpy ride, meals, snoring on the bus, entrance fees, and shared hair-raising cab rides extra.

This trip is limited to 8 photographers total.

results.description:
Nightlife impresario Richard ‘Ric’ Addison has opened the 5000 square foot Monarch Rooftop Lounge – Boasting an impressively expansive interior & exterior – Located at 71 W 35th Street – 18th Floor Penthouse.

Monarch opened with cocktail and light fare menu fit for the sizzling summer months in New York City. Boasting an impressively expansive interior and exterior space, Monarch can comfortably accommodate more than 300 guests. The dessert menu consists of delectable hand crafted dishes by Bindi of delicious chocolates & coffee.

The Scandinavian-chic décor, designed by Natalia Todorova of Gwathmey, Seigal, Kaufman Architects, features an indoor lounge that radiates glamour and allures with seductive appeal, seamlessly connecting to the exterior oasis patio with sliding floor to ceiling glass doors. Vintage bricks, white painted hand washed wood panels on the walls, teak and grey custom Terrazzo tiles, and raw iron columns evoke a feeling of a Scandinavian summer home with accents of Manhattan elegance. Black pendants designed by Tom Dixon cast gold shadows on the natural tree form bar counter top and glass lighting fixtures project down to reflect on the modern wood walls. The modern, yet unimposing deep seated upholstered sofas invite guests to relax and bask in the views of Midtown Manhattan, while floor to ceiling silk curtains frame the picturesque view of the iconic Empire State Building.

Place: Monarch Rooftop Lounge

Cost: FREE admission; mention Jack to get this free admission all night.

Strict Dress Code: No sneakers or boots for guys & shirt is required; ladies dress sexy & high heel preferred. Please dress up nicely; entry is at the doorman's discretion. 

21+ with government issued ID

Official Site: http://addisongroupnyc.com/venues/monarch/

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.description:
We will stage at Bed Bath & Beyond at 8:00 AM Kickstands up 8:30 AM then head up to Norwalk CT to register.

Ride Information:
The event begins in Norwalk, CT at Exit 17 off I-95 (Norden Park). Registration opens at 8:30 and Ceremonies begin at 10:30. The Ride begins at 11:30 a.m. The Ride ending at Seaside Park in Bridgeport for an afternoon of food, and music with performances by both rock and blues bands.

Donation:
The donation per motorcycle is rider $25.00 and passenger $25.00. A donation is required to ride in the escorted line! Parade Route
Motorcade from Norden Park to Rte 136
to Rte 33 through Westport
to Wilton Rte 7
to Rte 107 Georgetown
to Rte 58N Redding
to Rte 302 Bethel
to Newtown Rte 25 through Monroe
to Main Street Trumbull
to Old Town Rd
to Park Ave in Fairfield
continuing into Bridgeport and straight down to Seaside Park with Bpt's Fire Rescue 5 leading the Motorcade.

We will have vendors, food and entertainment, as well as the possibility of some celebrities. Last Sept. we ended with 2,300 motorcycles at Seaside Park! The first year's ride was for NYC, since then we are raising funds for CT Firefighters, CT Law Enforcement, and two local United Ways.

THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
results.name: Sunday at McLaughlin park 8:00 AM

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.name: SCUBA Lessons at the Pool

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>
results.name: Tennis Social

results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: Be sure to check the site for those who have signed up. We're usually easy to spot.

results.description:
Bronx Equestrian Center is a full service equestrian facility located in Pelham Bay Park. Western and English styles of riding are available for all levels of experience and interest. From pony rides and trail rides to haywagon rides and weddings... we have something for everyone. Come and say hello and meet our friendly horses and staff.

Trail Riding

Enjoy a relaxing ride thru the beautiful woods of Pelham Bay Park. We have horses for people of all riding abilities – from beginer to advanced. 

After the riding, we can have lunch at nearby picturesque City Island.

Depart Date: August 30th Sunday; arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 8:45 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)


Depart 9:30 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to be back in NYC at 3:30 PM and Flushing at 4:00 PM

Cost: Early birds $59 for first 8 spots or 10 days in advance; Regular $69 afterward. Please only RSVP here after you have purchased the ticket.

Trip includes: Round trip transportation from NYC & 1 hour of horseback riding.

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug2015horsebackriding.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot is not confirmed until your payment is received.

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled 2 weeks in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, you can transfer your spot to other with $10 transfer fee.

Official Site: http://www.bronxequestriancenter.com/

Pictures from the Previous Trips:
http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/24484822/
http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/25708012/

Video: How To Ride a Horse
http://youtu.be/PV8QJ4QJgtY

http://youtu.be/PV8QJ4QJgtY

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description: This Sunday, lets meet 9am at the Claypit Creek parking area located at Hartshorne Woods.  On Locust Ave, you will see a Hartshorne Woods - Claypit Creek sign to the parking area.  Use 259 Locust Ave, Rumson, NJ for your GPS.  You can get detailed driving directions to the Claypit Creek parking area off of the Monmouth County Park System website - specific to the Hartshorne Woods park.  The park system rates this as an easy to moderate walk of approximately 4 miles.  The county created a new trail recently that links the Claypit Creek area with the existing Laurel Ridge trail in Hartshorne Woods. There are some uneven / hilly sections of trail and more than a few tree roots and rocks, so wear hiking boots if you prefer.  Though this walk is mostly shady, a liter of water is good to bring along.  Since the local restaurants are still busy with the summer crowd, please bring food to share for after the walk. There are picnic tables and a porto adjacent to the Claypit Creek parking area.  Thanks for coming 10 minutes early - and please no furry, four-legged friends.

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arrming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
World Kitchen Garden Day was initiated by Roger Doiron of Kitchen Gardeners International as "an annual, decentralized celebration of food produced on a human-scale. It is recognized each year on the last Sunday of August. It is an opportunity for people around the world to gather in their gardens with friends, family, and members of their local community to celebrate the multiple pleasures and benefits of home-grown, hand-made foods". http://kgi.org/

"World Kitchen Garden Day Goals:

To celebrate the positive role of organic kitchen gardening in society, health, and gastronomy

To raise awareness about the benefits of eating local and to encourage people to explore local food options in their areas

To build community spirit, at local and international levels, around the universal experiences of gardening, cooking, and eating"

Take a look at photos from our past WKGDay virtual Meetups - http://www.meetup.com/GreenNewYorkers/photos/3070511/#[masked] http://www.meetup.com/GreenNewYorkers/events/31114471/

Please add your WKG Day photos just like previous years ... and include the LOGO below if possible!

results.description:
Приглашаю на маршрут с великолепными видами Shawangunk  Ridge и  озера Minnewaska. Маршрут занимает приблизительно 5-6 часов. (8 миль)

Ваша фото коллекцияпополнится великолепными видами

На маршруте нет больших перепадов бысот.

Уровень сложности отначального до среднего.

Вам необходимы:

- Ботинки

- Вода

Карта: Shawangunk Trails #104

Стоимость парковки : $8 за машину

===========================================

Join us for one of the most scenic hikes in upstate New York: Gertrude's Nose with Lake Minnewaska!

Gertrude's Nose is a great loop hike that runs along dramatic cliffs of Shawangunk conglomerate,with exceptionally fine views. We will start our hike with a great view of Lake Minnewaska.

Level: Beginner to intermediate. 8 miles

We will make multiple photo stops

Map : Shawangunk Trails #104

Parking Fee: $8

You need:

- Hiking boots

- Long Pants

-Water

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

GPS Coordinates for Google Map:[masked] [masked] 

http://www.roberts-1.com/minnewaska/getting_here/

top parking lot

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Driving Directions:


Take the New York State Thruway to Exit 18 (New Paltz). After paying the toll, turn left onto

Route 299 and continue west through the Village of New Paltz. When you cross the bridge over

the Wallkill River at the west end of the village, continue ahead on Route 299(do not turn right

towards the Mohonk Mountain House). In another 5.5 miles (from the Wallkill River bridge),


Route 299 ends at a T intersection with Route 44/55. Turn right here and follow Route 44/55

as it negotiates a very sharp hairpin turn and climbs to pass under the Trapps Bridge (a steel

overpass). Continue for about three miles past the Trapps Bridge to the entrance to Minnewaska

State Park, on the left side of the road. A parking fee is charged at the gatehouse. Continue uphill

for 0.4 mile to the parking area at Lake Minnewaska.


--------------------------------

When you sign up with this group for any of the events you have read and understand the following:

If you join us for hiking (or any other event), understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. It is your responsibility to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on this trip signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Please review safety information.

http://www.meetup.com/Brodyaga/files/

results.description:
Supposed to be another great Summer day, so come out and play. Bring your racquet and some lightly used or new balls and we'll rally and play some doubles.

Weather: Check back for any cancellations due to poor weather or otherwise.

Transit: 6 train to last stop at Pelham Bay Park and short walk. BX5, BX12 and BX29 within walking distance.

• Court number/location will be announced in comments upon arrival.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. Come join us as we knock off two shorter bushwhacks in the Adirondacks!

WE WILL MEET at South Meadows Rd just off Adirondack LOJ Rd. (If there is no parking left we will head over to LOJ parking lot just down the road)


[masked], [masked]


Our plan pending good weather will be to hike Both Street and Nye Mountains and be back in time for Crepes in Lake Placid. The group will be expected to move at a decent pace of at least 1 mph uphill and 2 mph on level or downhill terrain. http://www.lakeplacid.com/do/hiking/street-mountain

http://www.lakeplacid.com/do/hiking/nye-mountain


Distance: Approximately 8.4 miles

Hiking Pace: up to 2.0 mph

Estimated Hike Time: 5 hours

Difficulty: Intermediate - Rocky Terrain, steep Ascents and Descents some of which may require the use of Ladders

Current Weather Forecast:  Mostly Sunny with a high of 75 degrees



RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Shoes with good grip

• Gaiters

• A Backpack - with Raincoat/Windbreaker

• Hiking Poles

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, Lunch, First Aid, Headlamp, Sun Protection, Bug Spray, etc.


RELATED MAPS:

Adirondack Park - Lake Placid / High Peaks Trail Map #742


After our hike we will head over to the Big Mountain Deli & Creperie for some Delicious Sandwiches & Crepes!


WHERE TO STAY?

I will be driving up early Friday and plan to hike both Friday and Sunday in addition to our Saturday Hike. I will be staying the whole weekend at:

Lake Placid, NY 12946

Adirondack Hiking maximum group size limitations:

• A group size limit of 15 people for day hiking is in place. Any group larger than 15 must split up (by no less than 1 mile) into smaller, self-sufficient groups that satisfy the size requirement. These groups shall not congregate into one large group at trail junctions, rest stops, lunch breaks, etc.

results.description:
Are you Looking to get fit? 
Need to drop a few pounds? 
Want to get in shape for the summer?

Try a FREE class at CrossFit Outbreak Boot Camp in Ft. Greene Park.

Our Boot Camp classes are designed to introduce you to CrossFit. We want to get you fit and healthy, challenge your mind and body - we love to MAKE FITNESS FUN.

The first class is free, each class after that is $15.00.

There is no obligation to join our gym outside of this class. The Exercises: CrossFit is a combination of strength, cardio, muscle endurance, flexibility, core, and functional movement patterns. You get EVERYTHING you need!

Time Efficient Training. Our classes are 60 minutes in length. 
We utilize the principle of muscle confusion. You will NEVER do the same workout twice! Why is this good? Because…your body will never adapt and you will keep on getting stronger and fitter.

Make sure to click on the link below to register for the class and sign our waiver form ---> http://crossfitoutbreak.wodify.com/MembershipSales/ViewSchedule.aspx?LocationId=1895&IsMobile=False&OnlineMembershipId=14804

results.description:
Meet: EVENT LEADER PAT HORSCH at 9:30 AM Delaware Water Gap Dunnfield Creek / A.T. Parking Lot. Due to reduced parking available, recommend carpooling and/or arriving early. Contact leader for more info.  Cell phone for morning of the hike is[masked]

Water levels permitting, we will hike on the beautiful and shady Dunnfield Creek trail with multiple water crossings to Sunfish Pond, where we will have lunch and return on the AT. High water conditions will force an out and back on the AT. 9 to 10 miles, approx 5 hours, 1000' gradual elevation gain, some rocky terrain. Boots required, hiking poles highly recommended. Bring lunch & snacks, plenty of water, and extra socks.  Check this meet up site on the morning of August 30 for any changes/cancellations.

PLEASE ARRIVE 15 MINUTES EARLY AS WE LEAVE PROMPTLY AT 9:30.

Directions: GPS Coordinates: N 40° 58.30' W 75° 07.55'
I-80 West towards PA. After Exit 4, watch for the brown sign on I-80 for Dunnfield Creek and Appalachian Trail Parking 1 Mile. Exit at the Delaware Water Gap Info sign at mile marker 1 (shortly before Exit 1). We will meet at the second lot on the right for Dunnfield Creek / AT Parking, but you can park in the first lot and walk over if you wish.  The 2nd lot fills up sooner. If you miss the exit, take Exit 1, make a left under I-80, go past the info center and go back under the interstate towards I-80W. Turn left toward I-80W but exit at the parking lot on your right.  Additional parking is available in the info center on I-80 East and walk under I-80 to the meeting spot.

Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.

New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Meeting Your Dark Attraction And Awakening To Your Divine Nature
AN EXPLORATION OF FANTASIES, SEX AND LOVE

with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

Scuba Divers do an in depth exploration, Rock Climbers do it against the wall, Rockstars do it loud and Politicians do it to everyone. What exactly is this thing we do called sex and why are so obsessed with it? What makes it so pleasurable, titillating, frightening and shameful? Most of us think the other is satisfied, while we feel frustrated in our own desire and longing.

The primary processes of sexuality are energetic patterns created in our childhood, which are then mediated through the body. Most of us are not even aware of these energetic habits, such as the difference between being separate or merged or even our own preferences and those of our partners. Unencumbered from such habits, sex can become fresh, alive and open, an art form, a physical prayer, naked, unafraid and raw. Beyond self union, lies a greater union, a total orgasm with the whole, with Source itself.

This day long journey will be an exploration of how we can gain a conscious choosing over what and how our sexual energy moves. From pleasure to sharing, to heightening the spiritual embodiment of your sexuality, we will be in conscious exploration and discovery of these energies in you and how they affect your relationships.

The Awakened Sexuality Project is for participants who are longing for a deep spiritual journey and a strong willingness to venture and play where angels fear to tread. We will be working in the deep unconscious, uncovering where we turn away from some of our greatest gifts by delving into what has been deemed unspeakable and taboo. Through exploration of sexual fantasies, sexual constellation work, untamed passions, conscious play, body work, breath work, movement, intimacy, connection and respectful service to each other, we can come home to ourselves through a deep honoring of our gorgeous, unique and individual ways of loving.

When: Saturday Aug 30th, 2015, 10:00AM ~ 5:00 PM
Where: Institute of Core Energetics,
150 West 28th street, suite 1803, New York

Admission: $150 before Aug 23rd, 2015, $175 after

Tickets:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/meeting-your-dark-attraction-sexual-fantasy-tickets-18192974677

Dr. Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Questions?﻿ 
Call Kristina (917)[masked]


For future events for WOMEN ONLY check:http://www.meetup.com/Sex-And-Spirit/
